A common pronunciation of the eponym is vayg-a-ner. At a meeting in 1936, reported in 1937, Wegener described autopsy findings in three people with what he thought was an infective condition. They had granulomatous inflammation in the nose, generalised arteritis, and glomerulonephritis (Wegener F. On generalised septic vessel diseases. Translated in Thorax 1987; 42: 918-919). Friedrich Wegener (1907-1990) qualified in medicine in Germany, and became a pathologist in Kiel, and later elsewhere. His first autopsy was said to be on one of the people he described in 1936. The name Wegeners granulomatosis seems to have been used first in 1947

1484.caption: 58岁男性急性肾衰伴严重缺血性心脏病，考虑心脏移植。肾活检示皮质严重均匀小管损伤，早期萎缩为主，肾小球近正常，提示近期严重肾缺血。
1484.original_caption: Cortex in a renal biopsy specimen from a man of 58 with acute renal failure and severe ischemic heart disease, for which he was under consideration for heart transplantation. There is severe tubular damage, which mostly appears early atrophy, and affects the cortex uniformly. Glomeruli appear close to normal. These findings suggest severe recent ischemia of the kidney

1485.caption: 73yo male with nephrotic syndrome. Renal biopsy shows glomerular basement membrane thickening on H&E, suggesting membranous nephropathy. Requires immunohistologic confirmation.
1485.original_caption: Glomerulus in a renal biopsy specimen from a man of 73 with the nephrotic syndrome. On hematoxylin and eosin staining, there is uniform thickening of basement membranes, which makes them appear rigid. These features suggest membranous nephropathy, but further investigations, particularly immunohistologic study, are necessary to allow the diagnosis to be made

1486.caption: 56岁男性肾活检标本显示皮质，伴肾病综合征和急性肾衰竭。肾病综合征由早期经典节段性硬化性肾小球肾炎引起。存在急性肾小管损伤，类似6.1表现。曾疑肾静脉血栓但检查排除。肾衰竭后恢复，病因未明。
1486.original_caption: Cortex in a renal biopsy specimen from a man of 56 with the nephrotic syndrome and acute renal failure. The nephrotic syndrome is explained by an early form of classic segmental sclerosing glomerulonephritis. There is acute tubular damage, resembling the appearances in 6.1. Renal vein thrombosis was suggested as a possible explanation, but was excluded by appropriate investigations. Later, the renal failure recovered almost to normal, but the cause was not identified

1487.caption: 69岁男性肾活检显示皮质广泛血管炎改变，伴急性肾衰、血尿、蛋白尿。免疫过氧化物酶研究证实抗GBM抗体病（Goodpasture病）。Goodpasture综合征指肺出血伴肾小球肾炎，当存在抗GBM抗体时称Goodpasture病。该患者符合综合征，但未必满足现代Goodpasture
1487.original_caption: Cortex in a renal biopsy specimen from a man of 69 with acute renal failure, hematuria, proteinuria, and no other systemic features. Nearly every glomerulus has global vasculitic changes at the same early stage. Immunoperoxidase study, shown in 7.30, confirmed antiglomerular basement membrane antibody disease or Goodpastures disease. Good and pasture in the eponym are pronounced in the usual way. Ernest William Goodpasture (1886-1960) was a pathologist in the United States Naval Hospital in Chelsea, Massachusetts, when he did autopsies on two young men who caught influenza at the height of the pandemic in September 1918, but he was in Harvard Medical School when he described them (Goodpasture EW. The significance of certain pulmonary lesions in relation to the etiology of influenza. Only one of the two men had disease outside the lungs. He was 18 and had pulmonary hemorrhage, vasculitis in the spleen and small intestine, and a glomerular disorder with a fibrinous exudate in Bowmans space and proliferation in tufts. In 1958, M C Stanton and J D Tange suggested the name Goodpastures syndrome for the combination of pulmonary hemorrhage and glomerulonephritis, and they took no notice of the vasculitis in the spleen and intestine in the man reported by Goodpasture. Later, the term Goodpastures disease began to be applied when Goodpastures syndrome was associated with antiglomerular basement membrane antibodies, after linear deposition of IgG in glomerular basement membranes was reported in 1964. The man with renal disease reported by Goodpasture had Goodpastures syndrome, but may not have had antibodies to glomerular basement membranes, now considered essential for the diagnosis of Goodpastures disease

1488.caption: 43F kidney transplant biopsy 2w post-op. HLA class 2 Ab present. Graft dysfunction day 9: swollen kidney, oliguria, ↑creatinine. C4d+ in intertubular capillaries, no other rejection signs. Improved clinically but not functionally. Graft recovered without treatment.
1488.original_caption: Cortex in a needle biopsy specimen of kidney taken 2 weeks after transplantation into a woman of 43. Vascular access to allow hemodialysis was becoming so difficult that a cadaveric kidney was accepted for transplantation, even though the recipient had antibodies to HLA class two antigens in the donor. With extra immunosuppression at transplantation, graft function was satisfactory until 9 days after transplantation, when there was a swollen, tender kidney with oliguria and a marked rise in serum creatinine concentration. Biopsy was not done at that time, because there was a fear of rupture of the graft. Intensive treatment for presumed antibody-mediated rejection produced clinical improvement in symptoms, but not in renal function. The biopsy specimen is stained by an immunohistologic method for C4d, and shows extensive deposition in the endothelium of intertubular capillaries, but without any other evidence of rejection. The graft recovered function without additional treatment

1489.caption: Renal biopsy: inner cortex, arcuate vessels near medulla. Glomeruli show segmental sclerosis (arrows). Childhood late classic FSGS/segmental sclerosing glomerulonephritis. Same mag as 6.29 (outer cortex).
1489.original_caption: Inner cortex and arcuate vessels next to the medulla in the renal biopsy specimen from the girl of 3 whose outer cortex is seen in 6.29. Both figures are at the same magnification. A couple of glomeruli have areas of segmental sclerosis, arrowed. This is the typical appearance of the childhood form of late classic segmental sclerosing glomerulonephritis, which can also be called late classic focal segmental glomerulosclerosis

1490.caption: 21岁女性肾活检显示皮质，肾病综合征，系统性红斑狼疮临床复发，治疗2年。无急慢性肾小管损伤。肾小球纯膜性肾病，提示狼疮肾炎。系统性红斑狼疮可致肾衰，如Jack London、Flannery O'Connor、Ferdinand Marcos病例。
1490.original_caption: Cortex in a renal biopsy specimen from a woman of 21 with the nephrotic syndrome, and clinical reactivation of systemic lupus erythematosus that had been treated for 2 years. There is no acute or chronic tubular damage. Glomeruli have pure membranous nephropathy as a sign of lupus nephritis. In Latin, the word lupus meant a wolf. In English, the word was used for many centuries to mean a skin ulcer. This was well defined by Barrough in 1590: Lupus is a malignant ulcer quickly consuming the neather parts; and it is very hungry like unto a woolfe. Different types of ulcer became recognised, such as lupus vulgaris caused by tuberculosis. The name systemic lupus erythematosus had this basis rather than other suggested origins, such as the supposed resemblance of the facial rash to a wolfs face. Systemic lupus erythematosus is thought to have caused renal failure and death in the American writers Jack London (1876-1916) and Flannery OConnor (1925-1964), and the ruler of the Philippines, Ferdinand Marcos (1917-1989), who died after two renal allografts

1491.caption: Electron micrograph of glomerular basement membranes in a 28F with microscopic hematuria/proteinuria. Brother on renal replacement therapy. Membranes show irregular outer aspect, variable thickness, lamina densa splitting - features of Alport hereditary nephropathy.
1491.original_caption: Electron micrograph of glomerular basement membranes in a renal biopsy specimen from a woman of 28 with persistent microscopic hematuria and proteinuria. Her brother was on renal replacement therapy, but the cause of his renal failure was not known. The membranes have an irregular outer aspect, a range of thickness, and splitting of the lamina densa. These are features of hereditary nephropathy of Alport type.

1492.caption: 41M renal biopsy: chronic renal failure, hematuria, proteinuria, HTN. Chronic damage with tubular thyroidization, granulomas with giant cells, suggesting tuberculous pyelonephritis.
1492.original_caption: Cortex in a renal biopsy specimen from a man of 41 with chronic renal failure, hematuria, proteinuria, and hypertension. There is chronic damage with extensive thyroidization of tubules. In the chronic inflammatory infiltrate, there are granulomas that contain giant cells. These features suggest tuberculous pyelonephritis

1493.caption: 23yo female lupus nephritis renal biopsy: IgG immunoperoxidase stain shows mesangial deposition, membranous pattern on capillary loops, some intracapillary deposits (arrows)
1493.original_caption: Glomerulus in the renal biopsy specimen of the woman of 23 with lupus nephritis that is illustrated in 6.55. An immunoperoxidase stain to detect IgG shows deposition in mesangium, on the outside of many capillary loops in a membranous pattern, and inside a few capillary loops, arrowed

1494.caption: Renal biopsy, 37F, nephrotic syndrome. Immunoperoxidase shows heavy IgM deposition in early tip change, light mesangial IgM. Diagnosis: early classic segmental sclerosing glomerulonephritis (focal segmental glomerulosclerosis).
1494.original_caption: Glomerulus in a renal biopsy specimen from a woman of 37 with the nephrotic syndrome, examined by an immunoperoxidase method to detect IgM. An early tip change shows heavy deposition of IgM. Otherwise there is mesangial increase with light deposition of IgM. The diagnosis is early classic segmental sclerosing glomerulonephritis, which can also be called early classic focal segmental glomerulosclerosis

1495.caption: 49M with chronic renal failure, hematuria, proteinuria, hypertension. Renal biopsy shows IgA deposition in mesangium of surviving glomeruli and sclerotic glomeruli (arrow). IgA nephropathy.
1495.original_caption: Cortex in a renal biopsy specimen from a man of 49 with chronic renal failure, hematuria, proteinuria, and hypertension. An immunoperoxidase method to detect IgA shows deposition of IgA in the mesangium of surviving glomeruli, and also in a glomerulus with global sclerosis (arrowed). The diagnosis is IgA nephropathy

1496.caption: 42岁男性肾活检显示慢性肾衰、血尿、蛋白尿、高血压，17年前霍奇金病腹部放疗史。肾小球基底膜增厚，系膜区萎缩/消失（箭头），符合放射性肾病特征。
1496.original_caption: Glomeruli in a renal biopsy specimen from a man of 42 with chronic renal failure, hematuria, proteinuria, and hypertension, and a history of abdominal irradiation for Hodgkins disease, 17 years before the renal biopsy. In one glomerulus, basement membranes are doubled, and in the other, the mesangium appears to have shrunk or disappeared in several areas (arrowed). These are features of irradiation nephropathy

1497.caption: 30yo male, chronic renal failure, small symmetrical kidneys. Medulla shows chronic damage with cysts, cortex unaffected. Findings suggest medullary cystic disease.
1497.original_caption: Medulla in a renal biopsy specimen from a man of 30 with chronic renal failure and small, symmetrical kidneys. There is chronic damage with cysts. No cysts were seen in the cortex. These findings suggest medullary cystic disease

1498.caption: 54yo F with nephrotic syndrome & type 2 DM. Renal biopsy glomerulus shows C9+ arteriolar hyalinosis at hilum, indicative of diabetic nephropathy.
1498.original_caption: Glomerulus in a renal biopsy specimen from a woman of 54 with the nephrotic syndrome and insulin resistant or type two diabetes mellitus. An immunoperoxidase method to detect C9 shows that both arterioles at the glomerular hilum have hyalinosis, a feature of diabetic renal disease

1499.caption: Mesothelial hyperplasia with bland cytology.
1499.original_caption: Mesothelial hyperplasia. Note the bland cytologic features.

1500.caption: Mesothelial hyperplasia with tubule formation and bland cytology.
1500.original_caption: Mesothelial hyperplasia. Prominent tubule formation is associated with bland cytology.

1501.caption: Reactive mesothelial cells in regional lymph node (mesothelial deportation).
1501.original_caption: Reactive mesothelial cells in a regional lymph node (so-called mesothelial deportation).

1502.caption: Multilocular peritoneal inclusion cysts lined by bland multilayered epithelium.
1502.original_caption: Multilocular peritoneal inclusion cysts. The cysts are lined by a bland, multilayered epithelium.

1503.caption: Ectopic decidua. Well-demarcated nodule with cells showing abundant pink cytoplasm in adipose tissue.
1503.original_caption: Ectopic decidua. A well demarcated nodule composed of cells with abundant pink cytoplasm is present in adipose tissue.

1504.caption: Deciduoid malignant mesothelioma. Pink cytoplasm resembles decidua. Nuclear features malignant.
1504.original_caption: Deciduoid malignant mesothelioma. Note ample pink cytoplasm resembling decidua. The nuclear features, however, are clearly malignant.

1505.caption: Appendiceal mucinous cystadenoma with rupture and transmural mucin dissection.
1505.original_caption: Appendiceal mucinous cystadenoma. There is rupture with transmural mucin dissection.

1506.caption: Appendiceal mucinous cystadenoma with hyperplastic epithelium.
1506.original_caption: Appendiceal mucinous cystadenoma. Note the hyperplastic nature of the epithelium.

1507.caption: Low-grade appendiceal mucinous tumor with papillary architecture and low-grade dysplasia.
1507.original_caption: Low-grade appendiceal mucinous tumor. The tumor shows prominent papillary architecture and low-grade dysplastic features.

1508.caption: Low-grade appendiceal mucinous tumor with papillary architecture and low-grade dysplasia.
1508.original_caption: Low-grade appendiceal mucinous tumor. The tumor shows prominent papillary architecture and low-grade dysplastic features.

1509.caption: Pseudomyxoma peritonei. Intestinal epithelium with mucin in dense fibrous tissue (peritoneal adenomucinosis).
1509.original_caption: Pseudomyxoma peritonei. Bland-appearing intestinal epithelium is associated with mucin and is embedded in dense fibrous tissue (peritoneal adenomucinosis).

1510.caption: Pseudomyxoma peritonei. Abundant epithelium, some free-floating in mucin pools.
1510.original_caption: Pseudomyxoma peritonei. Abundant epithelium is present, some of which is free fl oating in mucin pools.

1511.caption: Pseudomyxoma peritonei with high-grade nuclear features (mucinous carcinoma).
1511.original_caption: Pseudomyxoma peritonei. Cells with high-grade nuclear features are seen (“mucinous carcinoma”).

1512.caption: Pseudomyxoma peritonei. Metastatic mucinous carcinoma w/signet-ring cells.
1512.original_caption: Pseudomyxoma peritonei. Metastatic mucinous carcinoma with signet-ring cells.

1513.caption: Desmoplastic small round cell tumor. Nests of small cells in desmoplastic stroma.
1513.original_caption: Desmoplastic small round cell tumor. Nests of small cells are present in a prominent desmoplastic stroma.

1514.caption: Endodermal sinus tumor. Schiller-Duval body: central vessel, loose stroma, outer mantle of cuboidal-columnar neoplastic cells, space lined by flattened tumor cells.
1514.original_caption: Endodermal sinus tumor. A Schiller–Duval body is composed of a central blood vessel surrounded by loose stroma with an outer mantle of cuboidal to columnar neoplastic cells present in a space lined by flattened tumor cells.

1515.caption: Endodermal sinus tumor. Reticular pattern merges with small cysts.
1515.original_caption: Endodermal sinus tumor. A reticular pattern merges with small cysts.

1516.caption: Mullerian cyst lined by columnar mucin-producing epithelium (inset)
1516.original_caption: Mullerian cyst. A cyst is lined by columnar mucin-producing epithelium (inset)

1517.caption: Vaginal adenosis: endocervical-type glands in superficial vaginal wall.
1517.original_caption: Vaginal adenosis. Glands lined by endocervical-type epithelium are present in the superficial vaginal wall.

1518.caption: Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor with heterologous elements. Benign GI-type mucinous epithelium adjacent to poorly differentiated SCLT.
1518.original_caption: Sertoli–Leydig cell tumor with heterologous elements. Benign gastrointestinal-type mucinous epithelium is seen next to poorly differentiated SCLT.

1519.caption: Stromal decidual reaction: lamina propria cells with bland ovoid nuclei, abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm.
1519.original_caption: Stromal decidual reaction. A compact collection of cells within the lamina propria have bland ovoid nuclei and abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm.

1520.caption: Walthard nest: pale eosinophilic cytoplasm, elongated nuclei, no atypia.
1520.original_caption: Walthard nest. The cells have pale eosinophilic cytoplasm and elongated nuclei without atypia.

1521.caption: Cystic Walthard nest. Unilocular cyst lined by attenuated epithelium. Focal multilayering.
1521.original_caption: Cystic Walthard nest. A unilocular cyst is lined by attenuated epithelium. More than one cell layer is focally present.

1522.caption: Pseudocarcinomatous hyperplasia. Tubal epithelium forms pseudo-glands with reactive cytologic changes. Florid acute inflammation present.
1522.original_caption: Pseudocarcinomatous hyperplasia. The tubal epithelium froms pseudo-glands and shows reactive cytologic changes. Note the associated florid acute inflammation.

1523.caption: Salpingitis isthmica nodosa. Small-medium glands, some irregular, penetrate fallopian tube wall.
1523.original_caption: Salpingitis isthmica nodosa. Small to medium-sized glands, some with irregular outlines, penetrate the wall of the fallopian tube.

1524.caption: Mesothelial hyperplasia, papillary architecture, low cytologic grade, no tissue invasion.
1524.original_caption: Mesothelial hyperplasia with papillary architecture. Note the low cytologic grade and lack of invasion into underlying tissue.

1525.caption: Diffuse malignant mesothelioma. Tumor cells show moderate cytologic atypia.
1525.original_caption: Diffuse malignant mesothelioma. The tumor cells exhibit moderate cytologic atypia.

1526.caption: Metastatic appendiceal adenocarcinoma. Tumor cells CK7 negative.
1526.original_caption: Metastatic appendiceal adenocarcinoma. The tumor cells lack CK7 expression.

1527.caption: Metastatic appendiceal adenocarcinoma with diffuse CK20 expression.
1527.original_caption: Metastatic appendiceal adenocarcinoma. The tumor exhibits diffuse CK20 expression.

1528.caption: Ovarian involvement by low-grade appendiceal mucinous tumor. Scant mucinous epithelium irregularly distributed in stroma with surface mucin pools.
1528.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by low-grade mucinous tumor derived from the appendix. Mucinous epithelium is scant, is irregularly distributed in the ovarian stroma and it is associated with pools of mucin on the surface.

1529.caption: Metastatic appendiceal adenocarcinoma with sheets of signet-ring cells.
1529.original_caption: Metastatic appendiceal adenocarcinoma. Solid areas are composed of sheets of signet-ring cells.

1530.caption: Vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia III. Full-thickness epithelial atypia. Intense MIB-1 nuclear staining. Diffuse p16 nuclear/cytoplasmic staining in all layers.
1530.original_caption: Vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia III. Full-thickness epithelial atypia is present (A). There is intense nuclear staining for MIB-1 (B) and diffuse nuclear and cytoplasmic staining for p16 in all epithelial layers (C).

1531.caption: Vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia III. Full-thickness epithelial atypia. Intense MIB-1 nuclear staining. Diffuse p16 nuclear/cytoplasmic staining in all layers.
1531.original_caption: Vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia III. Full-thickness epithelial atypia is present (A). There is intense nuclear staining for MIB-1 (B) and diffuse nuclear and cytoplasmic staining for p16 in all epithelial layers (C).

1532.caption: Vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia III. Full-thickness epithelial atypia. Intense MIB-1 nuclear staining. Diffuse p16 nuclear/cytoplasmic staining in all layers.
1532.original_caption: Vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia III. Full-thickness epithelial atypia is present (A). There is intense nuclear staining for MIB-1 (B) and diffuse nuclear and cytoplasmic staining for p16 in all epithelial layers (C).

1533.caption: Ovarian involvement by malignant mesothelioma. Tumor has packed tubules with cuboidal cells infiltrating stroma, mimicking adenomatoid tumor.
1533.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by malignant mesothelioma. The tumor is composed of closely packed tubules lined by cuboidal cells, which haphazardly infiltrate the stroma, simulating an adenomatoid tumor.

1534.caption: Ovarian involvement by malignant mesothelioma, papillary growth, lacks epithelial stratification/tufting of serous carcinoma.
1534.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by malignant mesothelioma. The tumor has a papillary growth and lacks epithelial stratification and tufting characteristic of serous carcinoma.

1535.caption: Borderline Brenner tumor. Nests/papillae lined by stratified transitional epithelium with mild-moderate atypia, resembling low-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma.
1535.original_caption: Borderline (low-malignant potential) Brenner tumor. Nests and papillae (A) are lined by stratified transitional-type epithelium with mild to moderate cytologic atypia, similar to that seen in low-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma (B).

1536.caption: Borderline Brenner tumor. Nests/papillae with stratified transitional-type epithelium, mild-moderate atypia, resembling low-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma.
1536.original_caption: Borderline (low-malignant potential) Brenner tumor. Nests and papillae (A) are lined by stratified transitional-type epithelium with mild to moderate cytologic atypia, similar to that seen in low-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma (B).

1537.caption: Metastatic endometrial stromal sarcoma. Diffuse growth of small blue cells. Nodular hilum suggests metastasis.
1537.original_caption: Metastatic endometrial stromal sarcoma. The tumor exhibits a diffuse growth comprised of small blue cells. The slight nodular configuration at the hilum suggests metastasis.

1538.caption: Metastatic endometrial stromal sarcoma. Collagen bands between small cell groups.
1538.original_caption: Metastatic endometrial stromal sarcoma. Collagen bands are present in between groups of small cells.

1539.caption: Immature teratoma with immature neuroepithelial rosettes in glial fibrillary background.
1539.original_caption: Immature teratoma. Multiple immature neuroepithelial rosettes are present in a glial fibrillary background.

1540.caption: Immature teratoma with primitive neuroepithelial tubules and atypical cellular glial tissue.
1540.original_caption: Immature teratoma. Immature neural elements include primitive neuroepithelial tubules and highly cellular atypical glial tissue.

1541.caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. CIN II: immature cells lower 2/3 epithelium, upper 1/3 maturation. CIN III: dysplastic cells all layers, atypical parakeratosis, syncytial basal growth, ↑N:C ratio, brisk mitoses.
1541.original_caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. (A) CIN II shows immature-appearing cells in the lower two-thirds of the epithelium associated with some maturation in the upper one-third (A) CIN III shows dysplastic cells lacking maturation throughout all layers associated with atypical parakeratosis (B) and prominent syncytial growth in basal layers accompanied by increased nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio and brisk mitotic activity, including an abnormal form (C).

1542.caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. CIN II: immature cells lower 2/3 epithelium, upper 1/3 maturation. CIN III: dysplastic cells all layers, atypical parakeratosis, syncytial basal growth, ↑nuclear:cytoplasmic ratio, brisk mitotic activity.
1542.original_caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. (A) CIN II shows immature-appearing cells in the lower two-thirds of the epithelium associated with some maturation in the upper one-third (A) CIN III shows dysplastic cells lacking maturation throughout all layers associated with atypical parakeratosis (B) and prominent syncytial growth in basal layers accompanied by increased nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio and brisk mitotic activity, including an abnormal form (C).

1543.caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. CIN II: immature cells lower 2/3 epithelium, upper 1/3 maturation. CIN III: dysplastic cells all layers, atypical parakeratosis, syncytial growth basal layers, ↑ nuclear:cytoplasmic ratio, brisk mitotic activity.
1543.original_caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. (A) CIN II shows immature-appearing cells in the lower two-thirds of the epithelium associated with some maturation in the upper one-third (A) CIN III shows dysplastic cells lacking maturation throughout all layers associated with atypical parakeratosis (B) and prominent syncytial growth in basal layers accompanied by increased nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio and brisk mitotic activity, including an abnormal form (C).

1544.caption: Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia III. Crowded monomorphic cells, hyperchromatic nuclei, no maturation. Diffuse MIB-1 nuclear staining & p16 nuclear/cytoplasmic staining full epithelial thickness.
1544.original_caption: Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia III. Crowded monomorphic proliferation of cells with hyperchromatic nuclei lack maturation (A). The presence of diffuse nuclear staining for MIB-1 (B) and diffuse nuclear and cytoplasmic p16 staining throughout the full epithelial thickness (C) supports this diagnosis.

1545.caption: Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia III. Crowded monomorphic cells, hyperchromatic nuclei, no maturation. Diffuse MIB-1 nuclear staining, p16 nuclear/cytoplasmic staining full thickness.
1545.original_caption: Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia III. Crowded monomorphic proliferation of cells with hyperchromatic nuclei lack maturation (A). The presence of diffuse nuclear staining for MIB-1 (B) and diffuse nuclear and cytoplasmic p16 staining throughout the full epithelial thickness (C) supports this diagnosis.

1546.caption: Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia III. Crowded monomorphic cells, hyperchromatic nuclei, no maturation. Diffuse MIB-1 nuclear staining & p16 nuclear/cytoplasmic staining support diagnosis.
1546.original_caption: Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia III. Crowded monomorphic proliferation of cells with hyperchromatic nuclei lack maturation (A). The presence of diffuse nuclear staining for MIB-1 (B) and diffuse nuclear and cytoplasmic p16 staining throughout the full epithelial thickness (C) supports this diagnosis.

1547.caption: Arias-Stella reaction: focal nuclear enlargement, hyperchromasia, clear cytoplasm, smudgy chromatin, no mitoses. Cervical endometriosis: nuclear crowding, hyperchromasia, edematous hemorrhagic stroma, small vessels. Tubal metaplasia: pseudostratification, preserved N:C ratio, no mitoses/apoptotic bodies, intercalated cells,
1547.original_caption: Arias–Stella reaction. There is focal nuclear enlargement and hyperchromasia of the lining epithelium. In contrast to AIS, the cells have abundant clear cytoplasm, smudgy chromatin, and no mitotic fi gures (A). Cervical endometriosis. There is nuclear crowding and hyperchromasia of the epithelial cells. Notice the accompanying edematous and focally hemorrhagic endometrial stroma and small vessels surrounding the endometrial-type gland (B). Tubal metaplasia. Nuclear pseudostratification and hyperchromasia are present. Of note, there is preservation of the nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio, absence of mitoses and apoptotic bodies, and presence of intercalated cells and cilia (C).

1550.caption: Adenocarcinoma in situ. Inked endocervical margin involved in cone excision.
1550.original_caption: Adenocarcinoma in situ. Involvement of the inked endocervical margin in a cone excision.

1551.caption: Invasive implants. Single cells w/ eosinophilic cytoplasm in fibrous septa.
1551.original_caption: Invasive implants. Single cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm are seen within the fibrous septa (B)

1552.caption: Serous borderline tumor (low malignant potential) with subcapsular sinus papillary tumor cluster in lymph node. Endosalpingiosis noted.
1552.original_caption: Serous borderline tumor (serous tumor of low malignant potential) involving a lymph node. A single small papillary cluster of tumor cells is present in a subcapsular sinus. Also notice the presence of endosalpingiosis.

1553.caption: Noninvasive implants. Cysts with papillae in omental septa. Smooth implant-fat interface, no desmoplasia (epithelial type). Papillae/single cells in edematous/inflamed/desmoplastic tissue. Demarcated implant-fat interface (desmoplastic type).
1553.original_caption: Noninvasive implants. Cysts containing multiple papillae are present in omental septa. The interface between the implant and adjacent fat is smooth and no desmoplastic reaction is seen (epithelial, non-invasive implant) (A). Small papillae and single cells are embedded in abundant edematous, inflamed, and/or desmoplastic tissue. Note the well demarcated interface between the implant and adjacent fat (desmoplastic, non-invasive implant) (B).

1554.caption: Noninvasive implants. Cysts with papillae in omental septa. Smooth implant-fat interface, no desmoplasia (epithelial type). Papillae/single cells in edematous/inflamed/desmoplastic tissue. Demarcated implant-fat interface (desmoplastic type).
1554.original_caption: Noninvasive implants. Cysts containing multiple papillae are present in omental septa. The interface between the implant and adjacent fat is smooth and no desmoplastic reaction is seen (epithelial, non-invasive implant) (A). Small papillae and single cells are embedded in abundant edematous, inflamed, and/or desmoplastic tissue. Note the well demarcated interface between the implant and adjacent fat (desmoplastic, non-invasive implant) (B).

1555.caption: Invasive implant. Complex glands, branching papillae invade omental tissue, effacing architecture. Epithelial predominance.
1555.original_caption: Invasive implant. Complex glands and branching papillae irregularly invade into adjacent normal omental tissue effacing the preexisting architecture. Epithelial predominance is characteristic of this type of implant.

1556.caption: Invasive implants. Complex micropapillary morphology. Single cells with eosinophilic cytoplasm in fibrous septa.
1556.original_caption: Invasive implants. Complex micropapillary morphology is present (A). Single cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm are seen within the fibrous septa (B).

1557.caption: Invasive implants. Micropapillary morphology. Single cells with eosinophilic cytoplasm in fibrous septa.
1557.original_caption: Invasive implants. Complex micropapillary morphology is present (A). Single cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm are seen within the fibrous septa (B).

1558.caption: Endosalpingiosis. Simple glands lined by ciliated cuboidal-columnar epithelium, minimal atypia. No papillary infolding.
1558.original_caption: Endosalpingiosis. Simple glands are lined by ciliated cuboidal to columnar epithelium with minimal cytologic atypia. Note the absence of papillary infolding.

1559.caption: Serous borderline tumor (low malignant potential) with low-grade carcinoma transformation. Borderline tumor (upper right) adjacent to stromal invasion.
1559.original_caption: Serous borderline tumor (serous tumor of low malignant potential) with transformation to low-grade carcinoma. Borderline tumor (upper right) is present juxtaposed to confluent invasion within the stroma.

1560.caption: Low-grade serous adenocarcinoma. Closely packed papillae, small cell nests with stromal clefts. Cytologic atypia exceeds serous borderline tumor.
1560.original_caption: Serous adenocarcinoma, low-grade. Closely packed papillae and small nests of cells are surrounded by stromal clefts. The degree of cytologic atypia is beyond that seen in serous borderline tumor.

1561.caption: Borderline mucinous tumor, intestinal type. Complex villous architecture resembling colorectal villous polyp. Cells show enlarged nuclei with visible nucleoli (upper right), contrasting benign areas.
1561.original_caption: Borderline mucinous tumor, intestinal type. A complex villous architecture resembles a villous polyp of the colorectum (A). The cells have enlarged nuclei with visible nucleoli (upper right) which contrast with the banal nuclear appearance in the coexisting benign appearing areas (B).

1562.caption: Borderline mucinous tumor, intestinal type. Complex villous architecture resembling colorectal villous polyp. Cells show enlarged nuclei with visible nucleoli (upper right), contrasting benign areas.
1562.original_caption: Borderline mucinous tumor, intestinal type. A complex villous architecture resembles a villous polyp of the colorectum (A). The cells have enlarged nuclei with visible nucleoli (upper right) which contrast with the banal nuclear appearance in the coexisting benign appearing areas (B).

1563.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. Tumor cells diffusely vimentin+ ER+.
1563.original_caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. The tumor cells are diffusely positive for vimentin (A) and ER (B).

1564.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. Tumor cells diffusely vimentin+ ER+.
1564.original_caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. The tumor cells are diffusely positive for vimentin (A) and ER (B).

1565.caption: Lobular carcinoma metastatic to endometrium. Tumor cells diffusely permeate endometrium, monotonous appearance.
1565.original_caption: Lobular carcinoma metastatic to the endometrium. The tumor cells diffusely permeate the endometrium and have a monotonous appearance.

1566.caption: Endometrioid carcinoma confined to endometrium. Irregular endomyometrial junction, may mimic myometrial invasion.
1566.original_caption: Endometrioid carcinoma confined to the endometrium. Notice the irregular endomyometrial junction that may be misinterpreted as myometrial invasion.

1567.caption: Typical leiomyoma. Spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, eosinophilic cytoplasm, no atypia.
1567.original_caption: Typical leiomyoma. Long fascicles of spindle-shaped cells with elongated “cigar-shaped” nuclei, eosinophilic cytoplasm, and no cytologic atypia.

1568.caption: Infarct-type necrosis. Mummified nonviable smooth muscle cells; cell outlines may persist.
1568.original_caption: Infarct-type necrosis. Uniform mummified appearance of the nonviable smooth muscle cells; however, the cell outlines may still be appreciated.

1569.caption: Infarct-type necrosis. Hyalinization with hemorrhage separates viable from nonviable tumor.
1569.original_caption: Infarct-type necrosis. An area of hyalinization associated with recent hemorrhage separates viable from nonviable tumor.

1570.caption: Cellular leiomyoma. Increased tumor cellularity vs surrounding myometrium.
1570.original_caption: Cellular leiomyoma. Tumor cellularity is increased in relation to the surrounding myometrium.

1571.caption: Polycystic ovarian syndrome. Follicular cysts beneath sclerotic cortex.
1571.original_caption: Polycystic ovarian syndrome. The follicular cysts are mainly distributed beneath the superficial sclerotic cortex.

1572.caption: Stromal hyperplasia. Nodular/diffuse hyperplastic stromal proliferation, bilateral, menopausal.
1572.original_caption: Stromal hyperplasia. Nodular and diffuse hyperplastic proliferation of cellular stroma is typically bilateral and found during menopause.

1573.caption: Dysgerminoma. Neoplastic cells in cords, separated by edematous stroma with scattered lymphocytes.
1573.original_caption: Dysgerminoma. The neoplastic cells are arranged in cords and separated by an edematous stroma containing scattered lymphocytes.

1574.caption: Dysgerminoma. Tumor cell nests separated by fibrous septa with lymphocytes.
1574.original_caption: Dysgerminoma. Nests of tumor cells are separated by fi brous septa containing numerous lymphocytes.

1575.caption: Dysgerminoma. Neoplastic cells show clear cytoplasm, large central nuclei, "squared-off" contour, prominent nucleoli.
1575.original_caption: Dysgerminoma. The neoplastic cells have abundant clear cytoplasm, large central nuclei, sometimes with a “squared-off” contour, and prominent nucleoli.

1576.caption: Dysgerminoma with epithelioid granulomatous inflammation.
1576.original_caption: Dysgerminoma. Prominent epithelioid granulomatous inflammation is seen.

1577.caption: Dysgerminoma with syncytiotrophoblast cells.
1577.original_caption: Dysgerminoma. Scattered syncytio trophoblast cells are present.

1578.caption: Dysgerminoma. Tumor cells exhibit diffuse nuclear OCT4 positivity.
1578.original_caption: Dysgerminoma. The tumor cells show strong and diffuse nuclear positivity for OCT4

1579.caption: Embryonal carcinoma. Solid primitive cells surrounded by cellular stroma.
1579.original_caption: Embryonal carcinoma. A solid growth of primitive cells is surrounded by cellular stroma.

1580.caption: Embryonal carcinoma. Pseudoglandular pattern cells with single-cell and discrete foci necrosis.
1580.original_caption: Embryonal carcinoma. Cells with a pseudoglandular pattern are associated with both single-cell and discrete foci of necrosis.

1581.caption: Choriocarcinoma: sheets of cytotrophoblasts draped by multinucleated syncytiotrophoblasts, hemorrhagic background.
1581.original_caption: Choriocarcinoma. Sheets of cytotrophoblast cells are “draped” by multi nucleated syncytiotrophoblast cells in a background of hemorrhage.

1582.caption: Yolk sac tumor. Reticular pattern with interanastomosing channels.
1582.original_caption: Yolk sac tumor. A reticular pattern is composed of interanastomosing channels.

1583.caption: Yolk sac tumor. Thin cords of neoplastic cells separated by loose stroma.
1583.original_caption: Yolk sac tumor. Thin cords of neoplastic cells are separated by loose stroma.

1584.caption: Yolk sac tumor. Papillary pattern, PAS diastase+ hyaline globules.
1584.original_caption: Yolk sac tumor. Papillary pattern with PAS diastase positive hyaline globules.

1585.original_caption: Yolk sac tumor. A typical Schiller–Duval body is present.

1587.caption: Metastatic large intestinal adenocarcinoma. Nodular growth in superficial cortex indicates metastatic carcinoma.
1587.original_caption: Metastatic large intestinal adenocarcinoma. Nodular growth in the superficial cortex is characteristic of metastatic carcinoma.

1588.original_caption: Metastatic large intestinal adenocarcinoma. Cribriform glands (garland pattern) are associated with abundant intraglandular necrotic material containing karyorrhectic debris (“dirty necrosis”).

1589.original_caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. Increased nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio, hyperchromatic nuclei, and coarse chromatin are seen on a Pap smear. Some nuclei have a “boulder-like” confi guration.

1590.original_caption: Atrophy. Cells with increased nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio and hyperchromatic nuclei mimic HSIL. However, nuclei are uniform in size and evenly spaced, and mitoses are absent.

1591.caption: 卵巢继发累及，阑尾来源低级别黏液性肿瘤，CK7阴性。

1592.caption: Ovarian involvement by low-grade appendiceal mucinous tumor. Diffuse CK20+.
1592.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by low-grade mucinous tumor derived from the appendix. Tumor exhibits diffuse CK20 expression.

1593.original_caption: Metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma. There is a nodular plaque of carcinoma on the ovarian surface, characteristic of metastases.

1594.caption: Ovarian secondary involvement by low-grade appendiceal mucinous tumor. Scant mucinous epithelium, abundant dissecting mucin (pseudomyxoma ovarii), fibrosis.
1594.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by low-grade mucinous tumor derived from the appendix. There is scant mucinous epithelium and abundant dissecting mucin (pseudomyxoma ovarii) associated with fibrosis.

Glassy cell carcinoma. Cells with large vesicular nuclei and prominent nucleoli are admixed with an acute inflammatory infiltrate containing many eosinophils (D).

1598.original_caption: Adenoid cystic carcinoma. Nests of tumor cells form cribriform spaces containing hyaline and mucinous material.

1599.caption: Adenoid basal carcinoma. Small nests, some with central lumen, composed of bland cells palisading at periphery.
1599.original_caption: Adenoid basal carcinoma. Small nests, some of them with a central lumen, are composed of cytologically bland cells that palisade at the periphery of the nests.

1600.caption: Small cell carcinoma: irregular nests of small cells, high nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio, hyperchromasia, stippled chromatin, apoptotic bodies.

1601.caption: Small cell carcinoma: irregular nests of small cells, high nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio, hyperchromasia, stippled chromatin, apoptotic bodies.
1601.original_caption: Small cell carcinoma. It is composed of irregular nests of small cells (B). The cells have markedly increased nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio, nuclear hyperchromasia, finely stippled chromatin, and numerous apoptotic bodies (C).

1603.caption: Psoriasis: thinned suprapapillary plates with dilated capillaries adjacent to epidermis.
1603.original_caption: Psoriasis. The suprapapillary plates are thinned and contain dilated capillaries, often in immediate apposition to the overlying epidermis.

1604.caption: Psoriasis: psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia with neutrophil-rich parakeratosis and absent granular layer.
1604.original_caption: Psoriasis. This well-developed lesion exhibits regular psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia surmounted by mounds of neutrophil-rich parakeratosis and loss of the granular cell layer.

1605.caption: Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, deeply invasive with HSIL. Irregular tumor islands, desmoplastic reaction. Tumor cells: eosinophilic cytoplasm, individual keratinization, nuclear pleomorphism.
1605.original_caption: Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma. 1606.caption: Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, deeply invasive with HSIL. Irregular, angulated tumor islands, desmoplastic reaction. Tumor cells show eosinophilic cytoplasm, individual keratinization, nuclear pleomorphism.
1606.original_caption: Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma. 1607.caption: Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, deeply invasive with HSIL. Irregular, angulated tumor islands with desmoplastic reaction. Tumor cells show eosinophilic cytoplasm, individual keratinization, nuclear pleomorphism.
1607.original_caption: Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma. The tumor is deeply invasive and is associated with HSIL (A); it is composed of irregular, angulated, or spiked islands of tumor cells associated with a prominent desmoplastic reaction (B); and the tumor cells have abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm with individual keratinization and prominent nuclear pleomorphism (C).

1608.caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. Irregular glands with desmoplastic stroma. Neoplastic glands lined by mucinous cytoplasm resembling endocervical epithelium.
1608.original_caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. The glands have irregular shapes and sizes and are associated with a desmoplastic stroma (B). The neoplastic glands are lined by cells with abundant mucinous cytoplasm resembling normal endocervical epithelium (C).

1609.caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. Irregular glands with desmoplastic stroma. Neoplastic glands lined by mucinous cytoplasm resembling endocervical epithelium.
1609.original_caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. The glands have irregular shapes and sizes and are associated with a desmoplastic stroma (B). The neoplastic glands are lined by cells with abundant mucinous cytoplasm resembling normal endocervical epithelium (C).

1610.caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. CEA+, nuclear/cytoplasmic p16+, vimentin-.
1610.original_caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. The tumor is CEA positive (A), it shows nuclear and cytoplasmic p16 (B), but it is negative for vimentin staining (C).

1611.caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. CEA+, nuclear/cytoplasmic p16+, vimentin-.
1611.original_caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. The tumor is CEA positive (A), it shows nuclear and cytoplasmic p16 (B), but it is negative for vimentin staining (C).

1612.caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. CEA+, nuclear/cytoplasmic p16+, vimentin-.
1612.original_caption: Mucinous adenocarcinoma, endocervical type. The tumor is CEA positive (A), it shows nuclear and cytoplasmic p16 (B), but it is negative for vimentin staining (C).

1614.caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma. Mucinous glands with papillary infoldings, no infiltrative growth, mimics ovarian atypical proliferative (borderline) mucinous tumor.
1614.original_caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma. Mucinous glands displaying papillary infoldings, without infiltrative growth, simulate a primary ovarian atypical proliferative (borderline) mucinous tumor.

1615.caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma with confluent glandular pattern mimicking primary ovarian mucinous carcinoma.
1615.original_caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma. The tumor has a confluent glandular pattern that simulates a primary ovarian mucinous carcinoma.

1616.caption: Primary peritoneal serous borderline tumor with psammoma bodies. Proliferation is noninvasive; tubal smooth muscle not invaded.

1715.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma, ductal type. The neoplasm is composed of solid nests of monotonous tumor cells.

1716.caption: Corpus luteum cyst: undulating contour, marked granulosa cell luteinization, distinct from follicular cyst.
1716.original_caption: Corpus luteum cyst. A corpus luteum cyst is distinguished from a follicular cyst by its undulating contour and marked luteinization of the granulosa cells (B).

1717.caption: Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma with subepithelial "cambium layer".
1717.original_caption: Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. A dense subepithelial “cambium layer” is present.

1718.caption: Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. Tumor cells desmin-positive.
1718.original_caption: Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. The tumor cells are desmin-positive.

1719.caption: Mesonephric adenocarcinoma. Tumor shows back-to-back cribriform glands with eosinophilic material (inset).
1719.original_caption: Mesonephric adenocarcinoma. The tumor shows back to back and cribriform glands containing abundant eosinophilic material (inset).

1720.caption: Vaginal atrophy. Squamous epithelium flattened, decreased/absent intracytoplasmic glycogen. Ki-67 shows rare basal layer positivity.
1720.original_caption: Vaginal atrophy. The squamous epithelium appears flattened with decreased to absent intracytoplasmic glycogen (A). Ki-67 immunostain demonstrates rare positivity in the basal layer (B).

1721.caption: Vaginal atrophy. Squamous epithelium flattened, decreased/absent intracytoplasmic glycogen. Ki-67 shows rare basal layer positivity.
1721.original_caption: Vaginal atrophy. The squamous epithelium appears flattened with decreased to absent intracytoplasmic glycogen (A). Ki-67 immunostain demonstrates rare positivity in the basal layer (B).

1722.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma. Neoplastic cells expand tubal plicae. Nest of neoplastic cells in lymphovascular space.
1722.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma. Neo-plastic cells expand the tubal plicae (A). A nest of neoplastic cells are present in a lymphovascular space (B).

1723.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma. Neoplastic cells expand tubal plicae. Nest of neoplastic cells in lymphovascular space.
1723.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma. Neo-plastic cells expand the tubal plicae (A). A nest of neoplastic cells are present in a lymphovascular space (B).

1724.caption: Female adnexal tumor of probable wolffian origin. Well-defined unencapsulated tumor in paratubal tissues.
1724.original_caption: Female adnexal tumor of probable wolffian origin. A well-defined but unencapsulated tumor is centered in the paratubal tissues.

1725.caption: Female adnexal tumor, wolffian origin, prominent cystic pattern.
1725.original_caption: Female adnexal tumor of probable wolffian origin. The tumor shows a prominent cystic pattern

1726.caption: Ovarian involvement by low-grade appendiceal mucinous tumor. Epithelium shows "hypermucinous" appearance due to merged extracellular and intracellular mucin in columnar cells.
1726.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by low-grade mucinous tumor derived from the appendix. The epithelium has a “hypermucinous” appearance because the extracellular mucin merges with the intracellular mucin of the columnar cells.

1727.caption: Ovarian involvement by low-grade mucinous tumor (appendix origin). Hypermucinous epithelium mimics primary ovarian tumor, lacks organization/epithelial tufting of atypical proliferative mucinous tumor.
1727.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by low-grade mucinous tumor derived from the appendix. Undulating low-grade, hypermucinous epithelium simulates a primary ovarian tumor, but lacks the organization and true epithelial tufting of an atypical proliferative mucinous tumor.

1728.caption: Cervical tuboendometrioid metaplasia with diffuse bcl-2 staining.
1728.original_caption: Cervical tuboendometrioid metaplasia. There is diffuse bcl-2 staining.

1729.caption: Cervical mesonephric remnants. CD10 luminal staining.
1729.original_caption: Cervical mesonephric remnants. Characteristic CD10 luminal staining is seen.

1730.caption: Endometrial adenocarcinoma, endometrioid type. Diffuse nuclear ER+.
1730.original_caption: Endometrial adenocarcinoma, endometrioid type. Diffuse nuclear ER positivity is characteristic.

1731.caption: Endometrial adenocarcinoma, endometrioid type. Diffuse cytoplasmic vimentin positivity.
1731.original_caption: Endometrial adenocarcinoma, endometrioid type. Diffuse cytoplasmic vimentin positivity is typically seen.

1732.caption: Endocervical adenocarcinoma. Diffuse cytoplasmic CEA+.
1732.original_caption: Endocervical adenocarcinoma. Diffuse cytoplasmic CEA positivity is seen.

1733.caption: Endocervical adenocarcinoma. Tumor cells show strong extensive p16 positivity.
1733.original_caption: Endocervical adenocarcinoma. The tumor cells show strong and extensive p16 positivity is present.

1734.caption: Cervical large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma. Tumor cells strongly, diffusely chromogranin positive.
1734.original_caption: Cervical large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma. The tumor cells are strongly and diffusely chromogranin positive.

1735.caption: Uterine serous carcinoma. Tumor cells show strong nuclear p53 positivity.
1735.original_caption: Uterine serous carcinoma. The tumor cells exhibit strong nuclear p53 positivity.

1736.caption: Ovarian serous carcinoma with strong nuclear WT1 positivity.
1736.original_caption: Ovarian serous carcinoma. The tumor shows strong nuclear WT1 positivity.

1737.caption: Metastatic mucinous (goblet cell) carcinoid. Tumor cells form trabeculae with goblet cells.
1737.original_caption: Metastatic mucinous (goblet cell) carcinoid. The tumor cells form trabeculae and contain goblet cells.

1738.caption: Metastatic mucinous (goblet cell) carcinoid. Acini form tubules resembling colonic crypts with atypical nuclei.
1738.original_caption: Metastatic mucinous (goblet cell) carcinoid. Some acini form small tubules and resemble colonic-type crypts but nuclei are notably atypical.

1739.caption: Metastatic mucinous (goblet cell) carcinoid. Tumor nests with signet-ring cells, atypical eccentric crescent nuclei deformed by cytoplasmic mucin vacuoles.
1739.original_caption: Metastatic mucinous (goblet cell) carcinoid. Tumor nests contain signet-ring cells, which have atypical, eccentric, crescent-shaped nuclei deformed by a cytoplasmic mucin vacuole.

1740.caption: Metastatic alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma. Tumor cells line irregular spaces with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm.
1740.original_caption: Metastatic alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma. The tumor cells line irregular spaces and some have abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm.

1741.caption: Metastatic embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. Poorly formed small cell aggregates with hypocellular areas.
1741.original_caption: Metastatic embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. Poorly formed aggregates of small cells alternate with hypocellular areas.

1742.caption: Clear cell carcinoma in endometrioma. Papillary architecture and malignant cytology indicate carcinoma.
1742.original_caption: Clear cell carcinoma arising in an endometrioma (not shown). The papillary architecture and malignant cytologic features warrant a diagnosis of carcinoma.

1743.caption: Low grade mesodermal adenosarcoma in endometriosis. Leaf-like processes, stromal condensation under epithelium.
1743.original_caption: Low grade mesodermal adenosarcoma arising in endometriosis (not pictured). Note the leaf-like processes and stromal con- densation beneath the epithelium.

1744.caption: Necrotic pseudoxanthomatous nodule, seen in long-standing lesions.
1744.original_caption: Necrotic pseudoxanthomatous nodule. This appearance may be seen in long-standing lesions.

1745.caption: Hemosiderin deposition in endometriosis. No endometrial-type glands/stroma.
1745.original_caption: Hemosiderin deposition in endometriosis. Diagnostic endometrial-type glands and/or stroma are absent.

1746.caption: Polypoid endometriosis. No intraglandular stromal protrusions or stromal condensation vs müllerian/mesodermal adenosarcoma.
1746.original_caption: Polypoid endometriosis. In contrast with müllerian/mesodermal adenosarcoma, no intraglandular stromal protrusions or stromal condensation is seen.

1747.caption: Primary peritoneal serous carcinoma, high-grade. Solid/papillary growth with high-grade cytologic features.
1747.original_caption: Primary peritoneal serous carcinoma, high-grade. Solid and papillary growth patterns are associate with high-grade cytologic features.

1748.caption: Primary peritoneal serous carcinoma, low-grade. Similar to ovarian serous borderline tumor invasive implant. Uniform nuclear morphology vs high-grade tumors.
1748.original_caption: Primary peritoneal serous carcinoma, low-grade. Note similarity to invasive implant of ovarian serous borderline tumor. In contrast to high-grade tumors, there is uniform nuclear morphology.

1749.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma with confl uent cribriform architecture; may show spindled growth, solid tubular pattern (Sertoli-like), or follicular pattern (granulosa-like).
1749.original_caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. The tumor frequently shows a confl uent cribriform architecture (A); but may also have a prominent spindled growth (B); solid tubular pattern (simulating Sertoli cell tumor) (C); or follicular pattern (simulating granulosa cell tumor) (D).

1750.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. Tumor shows confl uent cribriform architecture; may have spindled growth, solid tubular pattern (simulating Sertoli cell tumor), or follicular pattern (simulating granulosa cell tumor).
1750.original_caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. The tumor frequently shows a confl uent cribriform architecture (A); but may also have a prominent spindled growth (B); solid tubular pattern (simulating Sertoli cell tumor) (C); or follicular pattern (simulating granulosa cell tumor) (D).

1751.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. Tumor shows confluent cribriform architecture; may have spindled growth, solid tubular pattern (simulating Sertoli cell tumor), or follicular pattern (simulating granulosa cell tumor).

1752.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma with cribriform architecture, spindled growth, solid tubular pattern (Sertoli-like), or follicular pattern (granulosa-like).

1754.caption: Endometrioid stromal sarcoma: cellular proliferation of uniform small stromal cells with oval nuclei, delicate arterioles resembling spiral arteries of proliferative endometrium.
1754.original_caption: Endometrioid stromal sarcoma. The tumor is composed of a cellular proliferation of uniform small stromal cells with small oval nuclei. Note numerous delicate arterioles resembling spiral arteries of proliferative phase endometrium.

1755.caption: Malignant mixed mesodermal tumor with heterologous elements. Malignant glands separated by sarcomatous stroma containing atypical cartilage. Biphasic pattern.
1755.original_caption: Malignant mixed mesodermal tumor with heterologous elements. Malignant glands are separated by cellular, sarcomatous stroma containing atypical, cellular cartilage (A). Note the distinct biphasic pattern (B).

1756.original_caption: Malignant mixed mesodermal tumor with heterologous elements. Malignant glands are separated by cellular, sarcomatous stroma containing atypical, cellular cartilage (A). Note the distinct biphasic pattern (B).

1757.caption: Borderline clear cell adenofibroma. Cystic glands with flat/hobnail cells, clear/pale eosinophilic cytoplasm, fibromatous stroma. No nuclear atypia/mitoses.
1757.original_caption: Borderline clear cell adenofibroma. Cystic glands, lined by flat and hobnail cells with clear or pale eosinophilic cytoplasm, are separated by abundant fi bromatous stroma. Nuclear atypia is not striking and mitoses are absent.

1758.caption: Papillary squamous cell carcinoma. Papillae with fibrovascular cores lined by malignant HSIL-like epithelium. No maturation, high nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio, no HPV effect, distinguishing from warty carcinoma.
1758.original_caption: Papillary squamous cell carcinoma. Papillae with fibrovascular cores are lined by malignant epithelium that resembles HSIL (A). Lack of maturation of the neoplastic cells with increased nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio and absence of HPV effect distinguishes papillary squamous cell carcinoma from warty carcinoma (B).

1759.caption: Papillary squamous cell carcinoma. Papillae with fibrovascular cores lined by malignant HSIL-like epithelium. No maturation, high N:C ratio, absent HPV effect distinguishes from warty carcinoma.
1759.original_caption: Papillary squamous cell carcinoma. Papillae with fibrovascular cores are lined by malignant epithelium that resembles HSIL (A). Lack of maturation of the neoplastic cells with increased nuclear-to-cytoplasmic ratio and absence of HPV effect distinguishes papillary squamous cell carcinoma from warty carcinoma (B).

1760.caption: Dermatophytoses. Perivascular dermatitis with focal parakeratosis. No fungi on H&E stain. PAS stain highlights hyphae in stratum corneum.
1760.original_caption: Dermatophytoses. A “nonspecific” perivascular dermatitis associated with focal parakeratosis is observed. No fungal pathogens are identifed on the hematoxylin and eosin stain (A). Fungal hyphal forms in the stratum corneum are highlighted by a periodic acid–Schiff-D stain (B).

1892.original_caption: Metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma. The glandular epithelium is well differentiated and comprised of columnar cells having pale cytoplasm and small, round, minimally atypical nuclei, simulating a benign primary ovarian mucinous tumor. The luminal edge displays an eosinophilic “brush border-like” zone which can be seen in some primary pancreatic adenocarcinomas.

1894.caption: Metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma. Diffuse CK7+ tumor.
1894.original_caption: Metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma. The tumor exhibits diffuse CK7 expression.

1898.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by follicular lymphoma. Tumor cells exhibit diffuse strong CD20 expression.

1899.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by follicular lymphoma. CD21 highlights the follicular dendritic cell network consistent with a follicle center cell origin.

1910.original_caption: Secondary involvement of the ovary by desmoplastic small round cell tumor. Discrete nests of cells are separated by scant stroma.

1942.original_caption: Metastatic large intestinal adenocarcinoma. The tumor lacks CK7 expression.

1945.original_caption: Lichen simplex chronicus. Thick eosinophilic bundles of collagen are arranged in vertical streaks within the papillary dermis.

1943.original_caption: Metastatic large intestinal adenocarcinoma. The tumor diffusely expresses CK20.

1946.caption: "冠状CTA显示左前降支近段非钙化斑块，管腔狭窄约70%。右冠脉中段肌桥，收缩期受压50%。左室射血分数55%，室壁运动正常。主动脉瓣轻度反流。建议优化药物治疗，考虑介入评估。"

1947.caption: Complete hydatidiform mole. Enlarged hydropic chorionic villi with circumferential cyto- and syncytiotrophoblast proliferation.
1947.original_caption: Complete hydatidiform mole. Enlarged hydropic chorionic villi are surrounded by exuberant circumferential cytoand syncytiotrophoblast proliferation.

1948.caption: Complete hydatidiform mole. Hyperplastic nonvillous trophoblast with cytologic atypia.
1948.original_caption: Complete hydatidiform mole. The hyperplastic nonvillous trophoblast shows striking cytologic atypia.

1949.caption: Early complete hydatidiform mole. Hydropic villi with mild trophoblastic hyperplasia. Myxoid background, "club-like" villi outline.
1949.original_caption: Early complete hydatidiform mole. Mildly hydropic villi show only slight trophoblastic hyperplasia. Note the myxoid background and the “club-like” outline of the villi.

1950.caption: Partial hydatidiform mole. Enlarged villi with "lacy" syncytiotrophoblast proliferation. Irregular villi outline (bottom).
1950.original_caption: Partial hydatidiform mole. Enlarged villi are surrounded by a “lacy” proliferation of syncytiotrophoblast. Note the irregular outline of some villi (bottom).

1951.caption: Placental site nodule: hyalinized center with peripheral cellular rim in endometrial curettage.
1951.original_caption: Placental site nodule. An incidental nodule found in an endometrial curettage shows a hyalinized center with a peripheral cellular rim.

1952.caption: Placental site plaque: elongated pink plaque replaces endometrium, separated from myometrium by inflammatory rim.
1952.original_caption: Placental site plaque. An elongated pink plaque replaces the endometrium and is separated from the myometrium by a rim of inflammation.

1955.caption: Epithelioid trophoblastic tumor with well-defined margin, composed of mononucleated cells forming nests and cords.
1955.original_caption: Epithelioid trophoblastic tumor. The tumor has a well defined margin and is composed of mononucleated cells forming discrete nests and cords.

1953.caption: Placental site nodule. Intermediate trophoblast cells w/ clear/vacuolated cytoplasm & vesicular/hyperchromatic nuclei in hyaline matrix.
1953.original_caption: Placental site nodule. Intermediate trophoblast cells with clear or vacuolated cytoplasm and vesicular or hyperchromatic nuclei are embedded in a hyaline matrix.

1954.caption: Placental site nodule. Small round nests at periphery, pseudoinfiltrative appearance mimics invasive squamous cell carcinoma (arrow).
1954.original_caption: Placental site nodule. Small round nests at the periphery of the main nodule with a pseudoinfiltrative appearance simulate an invasive squamous cell carcinoma (arrow).

1956.caption: Epithelioid trophoblastic tumor. Nodule with central vessel, surrounded by hyaline necrosis. Uniform cells: eosinophilic/clear cytoplasm.
1956.original_caption: Epithelioid trophoblastic tumor. A nodule of tumor cells with a central vessel is surrounded by extensive hyaline necrosis. Uniform cells have either eosinophilic or clear cytoplasm.

1959.caption: Placental site trophoblastic tumor. Mononucleated/binucleated cells, irregular nuclear contours, vesicular/dense chromatin.
1959.original_caption: Placental site trophoblastic tumor. Confluent growth of mononucleated and occasionally binucleated cells. The nuclei have irregular contours with either vesicular or dense chromatin.

1963.caption: Gestational choriocarcinoma. Cytotrophoblasts hugged by syncytiotrophoblasts with eosinophilic cytoplasm. Hemorrhagic background.
1963.original_caption: Gestational choriocarcinoma. Cytotrophoblast cells are “hugged” by elongated syncytiotrophoblast cells showing deeply eosinophilic cytoplasm. Notice the hemorrhagic background.

1962.caption: Gestational choriocarcinoma. Biphasic cyto- and syncytiotrophoblast growth.
1962.original_caption: Gestational choriocarcinoma. Biphasic growth of cyto- and syncytiotro- phoblast cells.

1960.caption: Placental site trophoblastic tumor. Neoplastic intermediate trophoblast cells infiltrate vascular wall with extensive fibrinoid deposition.
1960.original_caption: Placental site trophoblastic tumor. The neoplastic intermediate trophoblast cells infiltrate and replace the vascular wall and are associated with extensive fibrinoid deposition.

1957.caption: Epithelioid trophoblastic tumor. Nests of tumor cells with eosinophilic hyaline material and necrotic debris, resembling keratinizing squamous cell carcinoma.
1957.original_caption: Epithelioid trophoblastic tumor. Large nests of tumor cells are intimately associated with eosinophilic, hyaline-like material and necrotic debris mimicking keratinizing squamous cell carcinoma.

1958.caption: Placental site trophoblastic tumor. Intermediate trophoblast cells in sheets, abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm, vesicular nuclei.
1958.original_caption: Placental site trophoblastic tumor. Intermediate trophoblast cells grow in sheets and have abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm with vesicular nuclei.

1961.caption: Exaggerated placental site. Intermediate trophoblast cells with syncytiotrophoblast infiltrate myometrium. No mitoses.
1961.original_caption: Exaggerated placental site. Exuberant intermediate trophoblast cells associated with syncytiotrophoblast cells infiltrate the myometrium. Notice the absence of mitoses.

1964.caption: Choriocarcinoma in term placenta. Biphasic cyto- and syncytiotrophoblast growth adjacent to mature terminal villi.
1964.original_caption: Choriocarcinoma in a term placenta. A biphasic growth of cyto- and syn- cytiotrophoblast is juxtaposed to mature terminal villi of a term placenta.

1965.caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion, endocervical gland involvement. Smooth rounded gland contour, intact basement membrane, no desmoplasia.
1965.original_caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion, with prominent endocervical gland involvement. There is a smooth rounded contour of the gland with an intact basement membrane, and no associated desmoplasia.

1966.caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. Partial endocervical gland involvement.
1966.original_caption: High-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion. Partial involvement of endocervical glands.

1967.caption: Primary ovarian rete cystadenoma adjacent to ovarian hilum.
1967.original_caption: Primary ovarian rete cystadenoma. The tumor (left) is located adjacent to the ovarian hilum (right).

1968.caption: Primary ovarian rete cystadenoma. Flat bland cells, no cilia, smooth muscle bundles in cyst wall.
1968.original_caption: Primary ovarian rete cystadenoma. Flat bland cells without cilia are associated with smooth muscle bundles in the cyst wall.

1969.caption: Primary ovarian small cell carcinoma, hypercalcemic type. Geographic necrosis (left).
1969.original_caption: Primary ovarian small cell carcinoma, hypercalcemic type. Broad zones of geographic necrosis (left) are seen.

1970.caption: Primary ovarian small cell carcinoma, hypercalcemic type. Follicle-like spaces with eosinophilic fluid.
1970.original_caption: Primary ovarian small cell carcinoma, hypercalcemic type. Prominent follicle-like spaces filled with eosinophilic fluid are present.

1971.caption: Primary ovarian small cell carcinoma, hypercalcemic type. Round cells, scant cytoplasm, high N:C ratio, frequent mitoses.
1971.original_caption: Primary ovarian small cell carcinoma, hypercalcemic type. The cells are round and have scant cytoplasm, resulting in a high nuclear-to-cyto-plasmic ratio. Numerous mitotic figures are seen.

1972.caption: Massive ovarian edema. Ovarian parenchyma expanded by edema with extravasated erythrocytes. Entrapped primordial follicles present.
1972.original_caption: Massive ovarian edema. The ovarian parenchyma is expanded by striking edema associated with extravasated erythrocytes (A). Note the presence of entrapped primordial follicles (B).

1973.caption: Massive ovarian edema. Ovarian parenchyma expanded by edema with extravasated erythrocytes. Entrapped primordial follicles present.
1973.original_caption: Massive ovarian edema. The ovarian parenchyma is expanded by striking edema associated with extravasated erythrocytes (A). Note the presence of entrapped primordial follicles (B).

1974.original_caption: Metastatic endometrial endometrioid carcinoma. The tumor is composed of glands similar in appearance to a primary ovarian endometrioid carcinoma.

1980.caption: Diffuse malignant mesothelioma, predominant solid growth with focal papillary formation.
1980.original_caption: Diffuse malignant mesothelioma. The tumor shows a predominant solid growth with focal papillary formation.

1976.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma, small nonvillous papillae. Single cells/groups, abundant cytoplasm, no fibrovascular core, budding into neoplastic gland lumens.
1976.original_caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma with small nonvillous papillae. Single cells and groups of cells with abundant cytoplasm and without a fibrovascular core are budding into the lumens of the neoplastic glands.

1977.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma with microglandular-like features, abundant mucin, focal squamous differentiation, bland cytology mimicking microglandular hyperplasia.
1977.original_caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma with microglandular-like features. Notice the abundant mucin, focal squamous differentiation, and bland cytologic features mimicking microglandular hyperplasia.

1979.caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor. Enlarged hyperchromatic bizarre nuclei.
1979.original_caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor. Conspicuous enlarged, hyperchromatic (bizarre) nuclei are seen.

1975.caption: Metastatic endometrial endometrioid carcinoma forming interanastomosing cords resembling Sertoli cell or carcinoid tumor.
1975.original_caption: Metastatic endometrial endometrioid carcinoma. The tumor forms interanastomosing cords simulating a Sertoli cell or carcinoid tumor.

1981.caption: Diffuse malignant mesothelioma, low cytologic grade, myxoid stroma.
1981.original_caption: Diffuse malignant mesothelioma. Note low cytologic grade and myxoid stroma.

1982.caption: Endometriosis: endometrial gland with stroma and recent hemorrhage.
1982.original_caption: Endometriosis. An endometrial-type gland is surrounded by endometrial stroma accompanied by recent hemorrhage.

1983.caption: Fallopian tube prolapse. Bulbous clubbed folds (plicae) with tubal epithelium, some ciliated (inset)

1978.caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor. Tumor cells show grooved nuclei.
1978.original_caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor. Tumor cells characteristically show longitudinally grooved nuclei.

1984.caption: Female adnexal tumor, wolffian origin. Pseudotubules and solid areas admixed.
1984.original_caption: Female adnexal tumor of probable wolffi an origin. Pseudotubules and solid areas are intimately admixed.

1986.original_caption: Ependymoma. Elongated cells with abundant pink cytoplasm and elongated processes show a perivascular arrangement.

1988.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. Complex glandular architecture with back-to-back glands. No mucin. Pseudostratified oval/vesicular nuclei.

The cytologic appearance is uniform with moderate atypia (B)
