2026.caption: Trabecular carcinoid. Uniform cells in cords/trabeculae with perpendicular nuclei in fibrous stroma.
2026.original_caption: Trabecular carcinoid. Cords and trabeculae of uniform cells with perpendicular oriented nuclei are set in a fi brous stroma.

2027.caption: Strumal carcinoid: trabecular carcinoid + thyroid follicles.
2027.original_caption: Strumal carcinoid. Intimate admixture of trabecular carcinoid and thyroid follicles.

2028.caption: Mature cystic teratoma with skin and pilosebaceous units in cyst wall.
2028.original_caption: Mature cystic teratoma. Skin and pilosebaceous units are present in the cyst wall.

2031.caption: Struma ovarii. Stromal luteinization lower left.
2031.original_caption: Struma ovarii. Prominent stromal luteinization is present in the lower left.

2030.caption: Struma ovarii. Thyroid follicles with solid and microfollicular patterns.
2030.original_caption: Struma ovarii. Typical thyroid follicles are juxtaposed with solid and microfollicular patterns.

2033.caption: Retiform Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor. Prominent retiform growth. Small rounded papillae with hyalinized cores.
2033.original_caption: Retiform Sertoli–Leydig cell tumor. Prominent retiform growth (A). Papillae are small and rounded with hyalinized cores (B).

2034.caption: Retiform Sertoli-Leydig cell tumor. Prominent retiform growth. Small rounded papillae with hyalinized cores.
2034.original_caption: Retiform Sertoli–Leydig cell tumor. Prominent retiform growth (A). Papillae are small and rounded with hyalinized cores (B).

2032.caption: Mucinous carcinoid (goblet cell carcinoid). Cell nests in mucin pools. Inset: goblet cells and neuroendocrine cells.
2032.original_caption: Mucinous carcinoid (goblet cell carcinoid). Nests of cells are floating in pools of mucin. Inset: the nests contain goblet cells and cells with neuroendocrine differentiation.

2029.caption: Mature cystic teratoma. Fetal cartilage beneath respiratory epithelium and minor salivary glands.
2029.original_caption: Mature cystic teratoma. Fetal cartilage is seen underlying respiratory epithelium and minor salivary glands.

2035.caption: Chronic endometritis. Plasma cells in endometrial stroma. Lymphoid follicles may be present.
2035.original_caption: Chronic endometritis. Scattered plasma cells are present in the endometrial stroma (A). Lymphoid follicles may be seen (B).

2036.caption: Chronic endometritis. Plasma cells in endometrial stroma. Lymphoid follicles present.
2036.original_caption: Chronic endometritis. Scattered plasma cells are present in the endometrial stroma (A). Lymphoid follicles may be seen (B).

2037.caption: High-grade serous adenocarcinoma. Tumor cells form sheets, pseudoglandular spaces, papillae. Pleomorphic epithelial cells with prominent nucleoli.
2037.original_caption: Serous adenocarcinoma, high-grade. The tumor cells grow in sheets and also form pseudoglandular spaces and papillae (A, B). The epithelial cells are pleomorphic with prominent nucleoli (B).

2038.caption: High-grade serous adenocarcinoma. Tumor cells form sheets, pseudoglandular spaces, papillae. Pleomorphic epithelial cells with prominent nucleoli.
2038.original_caption: Serous adenocarcinoma, high-grade. The tumor cells grow in sheets and also form pseudoglandular spaces and papillae (A, B). The epithelial cells are pleomorphic with prominent nucleoli (B).

2039.caption: Psammocarcinoma. >75% tumor cell nests associated with psammoma bodies.
2039.original_caption: Psammocarcinoma. Greater than 75% of the tumor cell nests are associated with psammoma bodies.

2040.caption: Metastatic serous ovarian adenocarcinoma. Ascitic fluid with malignant cell aggregates, cytoplasmic vacuoles.
2040.original_caption: Metastatic serous ovarian adenocarcinoma. Ascitic fl uid contains aggregates of cytologically malignant cells with small cytoplasmic vacuoles.

2047.caption: Highly cellular leiomyoma. Small oval nuclei, scant cytoplasm, fascicles, thick blood vessel.
2047.original_caption: Highly cellular leiomyoma. Small cells with oval nuclei and scant cytoplasm focally form fascicles and are associated with a large and thick blood vessel.

2045.caption: Plasmacytosis mucosae. Plasma cell-rich band-like infiltrate in upper dermis. Overlying epidermis spongiotic with loss of stratum granulosum and corneum.
2045.original_caption: Plasmacytosis mucosae. A plasma cell-rich band-like infiltrate is present in the upper dermis. The overlying epidermis is spongiotic with loss of the stratum granulosum and corneum.

2046.caption: Plasmacytosis mucosae. Superficial keratinocytes show lozenge-shape. RBC extravasation, hemosiderin in dermis.
2046.original_caption: Plasmacytosis mucosae. The superficial keratinocytes focally exhibit a lozenge-shaped configuration. Note red blood cell extravasation and hemosiderin deposition in the superficial dermis.

2042.caption: Minimal deviation endocervical adenocarcinoma. Irregular glands infiltrate cervical stroma. Branching gland lined by mucin-rich columnar cells with hyperchromatic nuclei. Malignant glands adjacent to differentiated areas.
2042.original_caption: Minimal deviation endocervical adenocarcinoma. Complex, irregular glands infiltrate the cervical stroma in a disorderly fashion (A). An irregular branching gland is lined by cells with abundant intracellular mucin (B). The cells lining the neoplastic glands are columnar with small hyperchromatic nuclei and rare mitoses (C). However, notice the presence of overt malignant glands next to the better-differentiated areas (D).

2041.caption: Minimal deviation endocervical adenocarcinoma. Irregular glands infiltrate cervical stroma. Branching gland lined by mucin-rich columnar cells with hyperchromatic nuclei. Malignant glands adjacent to differentiated areas.
2041.original_caption: Minimal deviation endocervical adenocarcinoma. Complex, irregular glands infiltrate the cervical stroma in a disorderly fashion (A). An irregular branching gland is lined by cells with abundant intracellular mucin (B). The cells lining the neoplastic glands are columnar with small hyperchromatic nuclei and rare mitoses (C). However, notice the presence of overt malignant glands next to the better-differentiated areas (D).

2043.caption: Minimal deviation endocervical adenocarcinoma. Irregular glands infiltrate cervical stroma. Branching gland lined by mucin-rich columnar cells with hyperchromatic nuclei. Malignant glands adjacent to differentiated areas.
2043.original_caption: Minimal deviation endocervical adenocarcinoma. Complex, irregular glands infiltrate the cervical stroma in a disorderly fashion (A). An irregular branching gland is lined by cells with abundant intracellular mucin (B). The cells lining the neoplastic glands are columnar with small hyperchromatic nuclei and rare mitoses (C). However, notice the presence of overt malignant glands next to the better-differentiated areas (D).

2044.caption: Minimal deviation endocervical adenocarcinoma. Irregular glands infiltrate cervical stroma. Branching gland lined by mucin-rich columnar cells, hyperchromatic nuclei, rare mitoses. Malignant glands adjacent to differentiated areas.
2044.original_caption: Minimal deviation endocervical adenocarcinoma. Complex, irregular glands infiltrate the cervical stroma in a disorderly fashion (A). An irregular branching gland is lined by cells with abundant intracellular mucin (B). The cells lining the neoplastic glands are columnar with small hyperchromatic nuclei and rare mitoses (C). However, notice the presence of overt malignant glands next to the better-differentiated areas (D).

2048.caption: Leiomyoma with bizarre nuclei. Mono-/multinucleated cells show large nuclei, smudged chromatin, nuclear pseudoinclusions.
2048.original_caption: Leiomyoma with bizarre nuclei. Mono- or multinucleated cells in a patchy distribution show large nuclei with smudged chromatin and multiple nuclear pseudoinclusions.

2052.caption: Benign epithelioid smooth muscle tumor. Diffuse growth, abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. No atypia/mitoses.
2052.original_caption: Benign epithelioid smooth muscle tumor. Diffuse growth of tumor cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. No cytologic atypia or mitoses are seen.

2049.caption: Apoplectic leiomyoma. Central hemorrhage surrounded by cellular smooth muscle rim. Tumor shows zonation: less cellular away from infarct.
2049.original_caption: Apoplectic leiomyoma. A central area of hemorrhage is surrounded by a cellular rim of smooth muscle cells. The tumor away from the infarcted area is less cellular (“zonation” phenomenon).

2050.caption: Treated leiomyoma. PVA particles fill arteries.
2050.original_caption: Treated leiomyoma. Blue polyvinyl alcohol particles fill the arteries.

2051.caption: Leiomyoma with hydropic change. Edema dissects muscle fibers, creating false nodularity.
2051.original_caption: Leiomyoma with hydropic change. Extensive edema dissects the muscle fibers, imparting a false nodular appearance.

2053.caption: Benign epithelioid smooth muscle tumor. Anastomosing cords of tumor cells with hypocellular stroma.
2053.original_caption: Benign epithelioid smooth muscle tumor. Anastomosing cords of tumor cells are separated by hypocellular stroma.

2054.caption: Benign epithelioid smooth muscle tumor. Cells show abundant clear cytoplasm.
2054.original_caption: Benign epithelioid smooth muscle tumor. The tumor cells have abundant clear cytoplasm.

2055.caption: Dissecting cotyledonoid leiomyoma (Sternberg tumor). Disorganized smooth muscle fascicles with marked vascularity.
2055.original_caption: Dissecting cotyledonoid leiomyoma (“Sternberg tumor”). Swirling fascicles of disorganized smooth muscle are associated with marked vascularity.

2057.caption: Atypical polypoid adenomyoma. Immature squamous morules in endometrial glands.
2057.original_caption: Atypical polypoid adenomyoma. Several immature squamous morules fill the endometrial glands.

2064.caption: Actinomyces israelii. Sulfur granule surrounded by PMNs.
2064.original_caption: Actinomyces israelii. A sulfur granule is surrounded by polymorphonuclear leukocytes.

2062.caption: Acute salpingitis. Distended plica with dense neutrophilic infiltrate.
2062.original_caption: Acute salpingitis. A plica is distended and filled with a dense neutrophilic infiltrate.

2060.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. Irregular infiltrative glands adjacent to endometriosis.
2060.original_caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. Irregularly shaped glands have an infiltrative growth pattern (A). The adenocarcinoma is adjacent to an area of endometriosis (B)

2061.caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. Irregular infiltrative glands adjacent to endometriosis.
2061.original_caption: Endometrioid adenocarcinoma. Irregularly shaped glands have an infiltrative growth pattern (A). The adenocarcinoma is adjacent to an area of endometriosis (B)

2063.caption: Tuberculous salpingitis. Caseous necrosis with palisading histiocytes (granulomatous inflammation).
2063.original_caption: Tuberculous salpingitis. Caseous necrosis is surrounded by palisading histiocytes (granulomatous inflammation).

2059.caption: Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. Rhabdomyoblasts with cross-striations adjacent to fetal-type cartilage.
2059.original_caption: Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. Rhabdomyoblasts with cross-striations are seen next to fetal-type cartilage.

2056.caption: Atypical polypoid adenomyoma. Endometrioid glands with cribriforming and focal morules.
2056.original_caption: Atypical polypoid adenomyoma. Endometrioid-type glands show cribriforming and focal morular formation.

2058.caption: Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. Small blue cells beneath glandular epithelium ("cambium layer"). Alternating cellularity zones.
2058.original_caption: Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma. Condensation of small blue cells directly beneath the glandular epithelium (“cambium layer”). In addition, there are alternating zones of cellularity.

2065.caption: Adenomatoid tumor. Fallopian tube wall expanded by subserosal circumscribed uncapsulated tumor.
2065.original_caption: Adenomatoid tumor. The wall of the fallopian tube is expanded by a subserosal circumscribed but uncapsulated tumor.

2066.caption: Adenomatoid tumor. Irregular gland-like spaces, stromal lymphocytes.
2066.original_caption: Adenomatoid tumor. Irregular gland-like spaces and stromal lymphocytes are present.

2067.caption: Adenomatoid tumor with slit-like spaces and signet ring-like cells.
2067.original_caption: Adenomatoid tumor. The tumor shows numerous slit-like spaces. Note also the presence of signet ring-like cells.

2071.caption: Fixed drug eruption. Dyskeratotic cells in epidermis. Stratum corneum shows basket-weave appearance.
2071.original_caption: Fixed drug eruption. On higher power, dyskeratotic cells are present at all levels of the epidermis. The stratum corneum retains its open basket-weave appearance.

2068.caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor. Call–Exner bodies with eosinophilic basal lamina. Cystic variant shows focal Call–Exner bodies.
2068.original_caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor. Prominent Call–Exner bodies contain deeply eosinophilic basal lamina material (A). In the cystic variant, Call–Exner bodies are only focally seen (B).

2072.caption: Early invasive squamous cell carcinoma. Focal stromal reaction at crypt base, with extensive HSIL involving endocervical glands. Irregular nests of malignant squamous epithelium invade stroma.
2072.original_caption: Early invasive squamous cell carcinoma. At the base of a crypt, focal prominent stromal reaction is seen in a background of extensive HSIL involving endocervical glands (A). At high power, small irregular nests of malignant squamous epithelium invade the surrounding stroma (B).

2069.caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor. Call–Exner bodies with eosinophilic basal lamina. Cystic variant shows focal Call–Exner bodies.
2069.original_caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor. Prominent Call–Exner bodies contain deeply eosinophilic basal lamina material (A). In the cystic variant, Call–Exner bodies are only focally seen (B).

2070.caption: Fixed drug eruption. Lichenoid infiltrate with basal vacuolization, necrotic keratinocytes singly/clustered at dermoepidermal junction and spinous layer.
2070.original_caption: Fixed drug eruption. The lichenoid infiltrate is accompanied by basal vacuolization and abundant necrotic keratinocytes present both singly and in clusters at the dermoepidermal junction and in the spinous layer.

2074.caption: Borderline Brenner tumor. Nests/papillae with stratified transitional-type epithelium, mild-moderate atypia, resembling low-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma.
2074.original_caption: Borderline (low-malignant potential) Brenner tumor. Nests and papillae (A) are lined by stratified transitional-type epithelium with mild to moderate cytologic atypia, similar to that seen in low-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma (B).

2073.caption: Early invasive squamous cell carcinoma. Focal stromal reaction at crypt base with extensive HSIL involving endocervical glands. Irregular nests of malignant squamous epithelium invade stroma.
2073.original_caption: Early invasive squamous cell carcinoma. At the base of a crypt, focal prominent stromal reaction is seen in a background of extensive HSIL involving endocervical glands (A). At high power, small irregular nests of malignant squamous epithelium invade the surrounding stroma (B).

2075.caption: Borderline Brenner tumor. Nests/papillae lined by stratified transitional epithelium with mild-moderate atypia, resembling low-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma.
2075.original_caption: Borderline (low-malignant potential) Brenner tumor. Nests and papillae (A) are lined by stratified transitional-type epithelium with mild to moderate cytologic atypia, similar to that seen in low-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma (B).

2076.caption: Transitional cell carcinoma. Broad undulating papillae project into cystic spaces, minimal necrosis. Cytologic atypia similar to high-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma.
2076.original_caption: Transitional cell carcinoma. The tumor is composed of broad, undulating papillae projecting into cystic spaces with minimal necrosis (A). Cytologic atypia is comparable to that seen in high-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma (B).

2081.caption: Thecoma: spindle to plump cells, pale to vacuolated cytoplasm.
2081.original_caption: Thecoma. The tumor is composed of spindle to plump cells with pale to vacuolated cytoplasm.

2080.caption: Mitotically active cellular fibroma. Increased mitoses without cytologic atypia.
2080.original_caption: Mitotically active cellular fibroma. Increased mitotic activity is seen in the absence of cytologic atypia.

2079.caption: Cellular fibroma with increased cellularity, minimal collagen, no cytologic atypia.
2079.original_caption: Cellular fibroma. The tumor shows increased cellularity with minimal to no collagen deposition. No cytologic atypia is present.

2077.caption: Transitional cell carcinoma with broad, undulating papillae in cystic spaces, minimal necrosis, cytologic atypia similar to high-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma.
2077.original_caption: Transitional cell carcinoma. The tumor is composed of broad, undulating papillae projecting into cystic spaces with minimal necrosis (A). Cytologic atypia is comparable to that seen in high-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma (B).

2078.caption: Fibroma: short fascicles of bland spindle cells with storiform arrangement.
2078.original_caption: Fibroma. The tumor is composed of short fascicles of bland spindle cells displaying a striking storiform arrangement.

2082.caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. Ovary shows multinodular cortical growth.
2082.original_caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. The ovary can have a multinodular growth involving the cortex (B).

2083.caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. Ovarian tumor shows dense short intersecting fascicles of spindle cells, scanty eosinophilic cytoplasm, round-spindled nuclei, small nucleoli, minimal atypia, brisk mitosis.
2083.original_caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. The ovarian tumor is composed of dense short intersecting fascicles of spindle cells with scanty eosinophilic cytoplasm and round to spindled nuclei with small nucleoli, minimal cytologic atypia and brisk mitotic activity.

2084.caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. Nests of small luteinized cells among spindled cells.
2084.original_caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. Interspersed between the spindled cells there are nests and clusters of small luteinized cells.

2085.caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. Ovarian tumor edema causes microcysts.
2085.original_caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. Marked edema of the ovarian tumor produces microcyst formation.

2086.caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. Fibroblastic proliferation surrounds adipose lobules in omentum.
2086.original_caption: Luteinized thecoma with sclerosing peritonitis. A moderately cellular fibroblastic proliferation surrounds individual lobules of adipose tissue in the omentum.

2087.caption: Sclerosing stromal tumor with lobulated architecture, hypocellular/hypercellular areas, hemangiopericytoma-like vascular pattern.
2087.original_caption: Sclerosing stromal tumor. The tumor shows a prominent lobulated architecture, has hypocellular and hyper cellular areas, and a conspicuous hemangiopericytoma-like vascular pattern.

2088.caption: Sclerosing stromal tumor: spindle cells and round luteinized cells.
2088.original_caption: Sclerosing stromal tumor. The tumor is composed of an admixture of spindle cells and round luteinized cells.

2089.caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor, strikingly cystic.
2089.original_caption: Adult granulosa cell tumor. This tumor is strikingly cystic.

2090.caption: Primary ovarian endometrioid stromal sarcoma. Small oval cells in edematous stroma with prominent vasculature.
2090.original_caption: Primary ovarian endometrioid stromal sarcoma. The tumor is composed of small oval cells in an edematous background. Notice the prominent vasculature.

2094.caption: Endometrial carcinoma, micro-papillary growth. Atypical cells form irregular buds on endometrial surface.
2094.original_caption: Endometrial carcinoma with micro-papillary growth. Irregular buds of highly atypical cells are seen on the endometrial surface (C).

2091.caption: Primary ovarian endometrioid stromal sarcoma. Tumor nodules, some tongue-like, surrounded by collagenous stroma.
2091.original_caption: Primary ovarian endometrioid stromal sarcoma. Discrete tumor nodules, some with a tongue-like growth, are surrounded by collagenous stroma.

2092.caption: Papillary syncytial metaplasia. Epithelial cell clusters with eosinophilic cytoplasm, bland nuclei, stromal breakdown (right). Ischemic reparative changes in endometrial polyp.
2092.original_caption: Papillary syncytial metaplasia. Papillary clusters of epithelial cells with eosinophilic cytoplasm and bland nuclei are focally associated with stromal breakdown (right) (A). Reparative changes associated with ischemia are seen in an endometrial polyp (B).

2093.caption: Papillary syncytial metaplasia. Epithelial cell clusters with eosinophilic cytoplasm, bland nuclei, stromal breakdown (right). Ischemic reparative changes in endometrial polyp.
2093.original_caption: Papillary syncytial metaplasia. Papillary clusters of epithelial cells with eosinophilic cytoplasm and bland nuclei are focally associated with stromal breakdown (right) (A). Reparative changes associated with ischemia are seen in an endometrial polyp (B).

2095.caption: Postmenopausal endometrium. Inactive glands show slight pseudostratification, no mitosis. Atrophic endometrium has cuboidal cell strips without stroma (curetting).
2095.original_caption: Postmenopausal endometrium. Inactive endometrial glands show slight pseudostratification but no mitotic activity (A). Atrophic endometrium shows superficial strips of cuboidal cells in the absence of supporting stroma (curetting) (B).

2096.caption: Postmenopausal endometrium. Inactive glands show slight pseudostratification, no mitosis. Atrophic endometrium has cuboidal cell strips without stroma (curetting).
2096.original_caption: Postmenopausal endometrium. Inactive endometrial glands show slight pseudostratification but no mitotic activity (A). Atrophic endometrium shows superficial strips of cuboidal cells in the absence of supporting stroma (curetting) (B).

2097.caption: Atrophic endometrium, dense stroma, cystically dilated glands (hysterectomy).
2097.original_caption: Atrophic endometrium with dense stroma and cystically dilated glands (hysterectomy).

2098.caption: Pregnancy-related endometrial changes. Stromal decidualization: abundant pink cytoplasm. Hypersecretory endometrium: glands with infoldings, pseudopapillary formation, vacuolated cytoplasm.
2098.original_caption: Pregnancy-related endometrial changes. Stromal decidualization: Stromal cells show abundant pink cytoplasm (A). Hypersecretory endometrium: Endometrial glands with multiple infoldings and pseudopapillary formation are lined by cells with vacuolated cytoplasm (B).

2099.caption: Pregnancy-related endometrial changes. Stromal decidualization: abundant pink cytoplasm. Hypersecretory endometrium: glands with infoldings, pseudopapillary formation, vacuolated cytoplasm.
2099.original_caption: Pregnancy-related endometrial changes. Stromal decidualization: Stromal cells show abundant pink cytoplasm (A). Hypersecretory endometrium: Endometrial glands with multiple infoldings and pseudopapillary formation are lined by cells with vacuolated cytoplasm (B).

2101.caption: Intrauterine pregnancy. Immature chorionic villi, edematous stroma, nucleated RBCs in villous capillaries.
2101.original_caption: Intrauterine pregnancy. Immature chorionic villi with loose edematous stroma have nucleated red blood cells in villous capillaries (A).

2102.caption: Implantation site: Nitabuch’s fibrin adjacent to intermediate trophoblast.
2102.original_caption: Recent implantation site: Nitabuch’s fibrin is juxtaposed to intermediate trophoblast (B).

2100.caption: Arias-Stella effect: Enlarged hyperchromatic nuclei protrude into gland lumens (hobnail).
2100.original_caption: Arias–Stella effect: Enlarged hyperchromatic nuclei project into gland lumens (hobnail appearance) (C).

2104.caption: Pregnancy-related changes. Clear cell carcinoma: atypical cells lining neoplastic glands, focal papillary formation.
2104.original_caption: Differential diagnosis of pregnancy-related changes. Clear cell carcinoma: Neoplastic glands with focally papillary formation are lined by highly atypical cells (A)

2103.caption: Pregnancy-related changes vs. clear cell carcinoma: atypical cells lining neoplastic glands with focal papillary formation.
2103.original_caption: Differential diagnosis of pregnancy-related changes. Clear cell carcinoma: Neoplastic glands with focally papillary formation are lined by highly atypical cells (A)

2106.caption: Simple hyperplasia no atypia. Glands resemble proliferative endometrium.
2106.original_caption: Simple hyperplasia without atypia. The glands show cytologic features similar to those seen in proliferative endometrium.

2105.caption: Endometrial scarring: dense collagen entraps stromal cells. No trophoblastic proliferation. Old implantation site: nodular scar, no trophoblast association.
2105.original_caption: Endometrial scarring: Dense collagen entraps scattered stromal cells. No trophoblastic proliferation is seen (B). Old implantation site: A nodular scar is no longer associated with trophoblast (C).

2107.caption: Simple hyperplasia without atypia. Crowded endometrial glands, irregular shapes, cystic change.
2107.original_caption: Simple hyperplasia without atypia. The endometrial glands are crowded and show irregular shapes and cystic change.

2108.caption: Complex hyperplasia without atypia, increased architectural complexity, no significant cytologic atypia.
2108.original_caption: Complex hyperplasia without atypia. The lesion shows increased architectural complexity without significant cytologic atypia.

2112.caption: Endometrial intraepithelial carcinoma. Atypical cells lining endometrial glands, no stromal invasion. p53+, Ki-67+.
2112.original_caption: Endometrial intraepithelial carcinoma. Highly atypical cells lining endometrial glands, without evidence of stromal invasion (A). The cells show positivity for p53 (B) and Ki-67 (C).

2111.caption: Endometrial intraepithelial carcinoma. Atypical cells lining glands, no stromal invasion. p53+, Ki-67+.
2111.original_caption: Endometrial intraepithelial carcinoma. Highly atypical cells lining endometrial glands, without evidence of stromal invasion (A). The cells show positivity for p53 (B) and Ki-67 (C).

2109.caption: Complex hyperplasia with atypia. Increased glandular/stromal ratio, complex gland architecture. Cells show eosinophilic cytoplasm, lost nuclear polarity, round nuclei with nucleoli.
2109.original_caption: Complex hyperplasia with atypia. There is an increase in the glandular/stromal ratio and the glands have a complex architecture (A). At high power, the cells show eosinophilic cytoplasm, loss of nuclear polarity, and round nuclei with nucleoli (B).

2113.caption: Endometrial intraepithelial carcinoma. Atypical cells lining glands, no stromal invasion. p53+, Ki-67+.
2113.original_caption: Endometrial intraepithelial carcinoma. Highly atypical cells lining endometrial glands, without evidence of stromal invasion (A). The cells show positivity for p53 (B) and Ki-67 (C).

2122.caption: Mixed-pattern endometrium with proliferative and secretory glands.
2122.original_caption: Mixed-pattern endometrium. Proliferative and secretory glands are seen.

2114.caption: Metastatic large intestinal adenocarcinoma. Atypical epithelium surrounds cystic gland with necrotic debris ("dirty necrosis").
2114.original_caption: Metastatic large intestinal adenocarcinoma. Atypical epithelium is draped along the periphery of a cystic gland, which is filled with necrotic material containing cellular debris (“dirty necrosis”).

2123.caption: Squamous morular metaplasia. Nonkeratinizing squamous cell aggregates with bland cytology.
2123.original_caption: Squamous morular metaplasia. Aggregates of nonkeratinizing squamous cells show bland cytologic features.

2121.caption: Anovulatory endometrium. Cystically dilated irregular glands. Tubal metaplasia. Diffuse stromal breakdown with uniform tubular glands.
2121.original_caption: Anovulatory endometrium. Cystically dilated glands with irregular outlines (A). Some cells are ciliated (tubal metaplasia) (B). Anovulatory endometrium. Diffuse stromal breakdown in the presence of uniform tubular glands (C).

2124.caption: Mucinous metaplasia. Cells with pale cytoplasm, minimal architectural complexity. Mucinous proliferation with severe atypia indicates adenocarcinoma.
2124.original_caption: Mucinous metaplasia and mimics. Cells with abundant pale cytoplasm show minimal architectural complexity (A). A mucinous proliferation with severe architectural atypia is indicative of adenocarcinoma (B).

2120.caption: Anovulatory endometrium. Cystically dilated irregular glands. Tubal metaplasia. Diffuse stromal breakdown with uniform tubular glands.
2120.original_caption: Anovulatory endometrium. Cystically dilated glands with irregular outlines (A). Some cells are ciliated (tubal metaplasia) (B). Anovulatory endometrium. Diffuse stromal breakdown in the presence of uniform tubular glands (C).

2116.caption: Endometrial polyp: thick-walled vessels, dense stroma, irregular glands. Low-grade müllerian adenosarcoma: phyllodes fronds, hypercellular stroma, bland epithelium. Atypical polypoid adenomyoma: fibromuscular stroma, complex glands, squamous morular metaplasia.
2116.original_caption: Endometrial polyp. Thick-walled vessels, dense stroma and irregularly-shaped glands are seen (A). Low-grade müllerian adenosarcoma. Fronds with a phyllodes architecture show hypercellular stroma that condenses under bland epithelium (B). Atypical polypoid adenomyoma. Fibromuscular stroma surrounds complex endometrial glands with squamous morular metaplasia (C).

2110.caption: Complex hyperplasia with atypia. Increased glandular/stromal ratio, complex gland architecture. Cells show eosinophilic cytoplasm, lost nuclear polarity, round nuclei with nucleoli.
2110.original_caption: Complex hyperplasia with atypia. There is an increase in the glandular/stromal ratio and the glands have a complex architecture (A). At high power, the cells show eosinophilic cytoplasm, loss of nuclear polarity, and round nuclei with nucleoli (B).

2117.caption: Endometrial polyp: thick-walled vessels, dense stroma, irregular glands. Low-grade müllerian adenosarcoma: phyllodes fronds, hypercellular stroma, bland epithelium. Atypical polypoid adenomyoma: fibromuscular stroma, complex glands, squamous morular metaplasia.
2117.original_caption: Endometrial polyp. Thick-walled vessels, dense stroma and irregularly-shaped glands are seen (A). Low-grade müllerian adenosarcoma. Fronds with a phyllodes architecture show hypercellular stroma that condenses under bland epithelium (B). Atypical polypoid adenomyoma. Fibromuscular stroma surrounds complex endometrial glands with squamous morular metaplasia (C).

2119.caption: Anovulatory endometrium. Cystically dilated irregular glands. Tubal metaplasia. Diffuse stromal breakdown with uniform tubular glands.
2119.original_caption: Anovulatory endometrium. Cystically dilated glands with irregular outlines (A). Some cells are ciliated (tubal metaplasia) (B). Anovulatory endometrium. Diffuse stromal breakdown in the presence of uniform tubular glands (C).

2115.caption: Metastatic large intestinal adenocarcinoma. Cribriform architecture, endometrioid-type differentiation mimics primary ovarian endometrioid carcinoma.
2115.original_caption: Metastatic large intestinal adenocarcinoma. The cribriform architecture and endometrioid-type differentiation simulate a primary endometrioid carcinoma of the ovary.

2127.caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma. Pseudostratified columnar cells with hyperchromatic elongated nuclei. Mitotic figures and apoptotic bodies present.
2127.original_caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma. The mucinous epithelium is composed of pseudostratifed columnar cells with hyperchromatic elongated nuclei. Numerous mitotic fi gures and apoptotic bodies are seen.

2125.caption: Mucinous metaplasia. Cells with pale cytoplasm, minimal architectural complexity. Mucinous proliferation with severe architectural atypia indicates adenocarcinoma.
2125.original_caption: Mucinous metaplasia and mimics. Cells with abundant pale cytoplasm show minimal architectural complexity (A). A mucinous proliferation with severe architectural atypia is indicative of adenocarcinoma (B).

2118.caption: Endometrial polyp: thick-walled vessels, dense stroma, irregular glands. Low-grade müllerian adenosarcoma: phyllodes fronds, hypercellular stroma, bland epithelium. Atypical polypoid adenomyoma: fibromuscular stroma, complex glands, squamous morular metaplasia.
2118.original_caption: Endometrial polyp. Thick-walled vessels, dense stroma and irregularly-shaped glands are seen (A). Low-grade müllerian adenosarcoma. Fronds with a phyllodes architecture show hypercellular stroma that condenses under bland epithelium (B). Atypical polypoid adenomyoma. Fibromuscular stroma surrounds complex endometrial glands with squamous morular metaplasia (C).

2126.caption: Cervical microglandular change: Endocervical glands with abundant mucin, immature squamous metaplasia, may mimic mucinous carcinoma. Note striking subnuclear vacuoles.
2126.original_caption: Cervical microglandular change: Endocervical glands with abundant mucin and immature squamous metaplasia are closely apposed and may be confused with carcinoma with mucinous features. Notice the presence of striking subnuclear vacuoles (C).

2128.caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma. Diffuse strong p16 expression (nuclear/cytoplasmic).
2128.original_caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma. The tumor exhibits diffuse strong p16 expression (both nuclear and cytoplasmic).

2129.caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma. HPV 16 in situ hybridization shows punctate signals in tumor nuclei.
2129.original_caption: Metastatic endocervical adenocarcinoma. In situ hybridization for HPV 16 demonstrates numerous fine punctate reaction product signals within tumor nuclei

2130.caption: Lichen planus: band-like infiltrate at dermoepidermal junction with dyskeratosis, basal keratinocyte squamatization. Overlying epidermis shows acanthosis, hyperkeratosis, hypergranulosis.
2130.original_caption: Lichen planus. A band-like infiltrate is present at the dermoepidermal junction with resultant dyskeratosis and squamatization of the basal keratinocytes. The overlying epidermis is acanthotic with hyperkeratosis and hypergranulosis.

2131.caption: Lichen planus. Colloid bodies at dermoepidermal junction. Infiltrate spares interface, no suprabasilar extension. "Wedge-shaped" hypergranulosis and hyperkeratosis.
2131.original_caption: Lichen planus. Colloid bodies are present at the dermoepidermal junction. The infiltrate does not obscure the interface, nor extend into the suprabasilar epidermis. There is characteristic “wedge-shaped” hyper-granulosis and hyperkeratosis.

2132.caption: Erythema multiforme. Perivascular lymphohistiocytic infiltrate at dermoepidermal junction with vacuoles above/below epidermal basement membrane.
2132.original_caption: Erythema multiforme. A perivascular lymphohistiocytic infiltrate decorates the dermoepidermal junction inciting vacuoles both above and below the epidermal basement membrane.

2133.caption: Erythema multiforme, late phase. Necrotic keratinocytes in spinous layer. Preserved "basket-weave" cornified layer.
2133.original_caption: Erythema multiforme, late phase. Whorls of necrotic keratinocytes are present in the spinous layer. Note the preservation of the “basket-weave” pattern of the cornifed layer.

2134.caption: Acute HSV infection. Vacuolar interface dermatitis resembling early erythema multiforme. No epidermal viral cytopathic changes.
2134.original_caption: Acute herpes simplex virus infection. There is acute vacuolar interface dermatitis similar to that observed in an early lesion of erythema multiforme. No viral cytopathic changes are seen within the epidermis.

2135.caption: Acute HSV infection. HSV cytopathic changes in follicular unit. Detected on level sections.
2135.original_caption: Acute herpes simplex virus (HSV) infection. Characteristic HSV cytopathic changes are confined within a follicular unit. This finding was only detected on level sections.

2136.caption: Early lichen sclerosus. Psoriasiform hyperplasia, band-like lymphocytic infiltrate, dermal fibrosis, hyperkeratosis.
2136.original_caption: Early lichen sclerosus. Psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia is accompanied by a dense band-like lymphocytic infiltrate, papillary dermal fibrosis, and hyperkeratosis.

2137.caption: Advanced lichen sclerosus. Papillary dermal sclerosis with homogenization, pallor, vascular "drop-out".
2137.original_caption: Advanced lichen sclerosus. Marked papillary dermal sclerosis with homogenization, pallor, and vascular “drop-out” are present.

2138.caption: Late-stage lichen sclerosus. Papillary dermal homogenization displaces inflammatory infiltrate downward.
2138.original_caption: Late-stage lichen sclerosus. Extensive papillary dermal homogenization forces the inflammatory infiltrate downward.

2139.caption: Secondary syphilis. Psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia with band-like lymphocytic, plasmacytic, histiocytic infiltrate.
2139.original_caption: Secondary syphilis. Psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia with a band-like infiltrate composed of lymphocytes, plasma cells, and histiocytes is observed.

2140.caption: Secondary syphilis. Mixed plasma cell/histiocytic infiltrate in superficial dermis with mild endothelial swelling.
2140.original_caption: Secondary syphilis. A mixed plasma cell and histiocytic inflammatory infiltrate is present in the superficial dermis associated with mild endothelial swelling.

2141.caption: Subacute spongiotic dermatitis (atopic). Psoriasiform hyperplasia, parakeratosis, spongiotic microvesicles, lymphocyte exocytosis, perivascular lymphohistiocytic infiltrate.
2141.original_caption: Subacute spongiotic dermatitis (atopic dermatitis). Psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia and parakeratosis are accompanied by spongiotic microvesicles, lymphocyte exocytosis, and a perivascular lymphohistio-cytic infiltrate.

2142.caption: Spongiotic dermatitis (allergic contact dermatitis). Spongiotic microvesicles in epidermis with "Swiss-cheese" appearance, lymphocyte exocytosis. Stratum corneum intact, indicating acute insult.
2142.original_caption: Spongiotic dermatitis (allergic contact dermatitis). Spongiotic microvesicles are formed within various levels of the epidermis, imparting a “Swiss-cheese” appearance, accompanied by exocytosis of lymphocytes. The stratum corneum remains unchanged, reflecting the acute nature of the insult.

2143.caption: Spongiotic dermatitis (irritant contact dermatitis). Mild spongiosis with Langerhans cell micro-abscesses. Marked edema and vasodilatation in papillary dermis.
2143.original_caption: Spongiotic dermatitis (irritant contact dermatitis). This case exhibitsonly mild spongiosis with the formation of Langerhans cell micro-abscesses. Marked edema and vasodilatation are present in the papillary dermis.

2144.caption: Seborrheic dermatitis. Psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia with spongiosis, parakeratotic scale crust, mild papillary dermal edema, perivascular lymphohistiocytic dermatitis.
2144.original_caption: Seborrheic dermatitis. There is psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia with spongiosis, a parakeratotic scale crust, mild papillary dermal edema, and a perivascular dermatitis composed of lymphocytes and histiocytes.

2145.caption: Seborrheic dermatitis. Parafollicular para-keratosis ("shoulder parakeratosis") with neutrophil exocytosis and spongiotic foci.
2145.original_caption: Seborrheic dermatitis. Characteristic parafollicular accentuation of para-keratosis (“shoulder parakeratosis”) is accompanied by exocytosis of neutrophils into the scale crust and spongiotic foci.

2146.caption: Lichen simplex chronicus: broad compact orthokeratosis, hypergranulosis, psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia without suprapapillary plate thinning.
2146.original_caption: Lichen simplex chronicus. There is broad compact orthokeratosis and hypergranulosis. The psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia does not exhibit suprapapillary plate thinning.

2150.caption: Angiomyofibroblastoma. Hypocellular/hypercellular areas. Tumor cells cluster around capillary-sized vessels.
2150.original_caption: Angiomyofibroblastoma. Alternating hypocellular and hypercellular areas are seen. Tumor cells tend to cluster around numerous capillary-sized vessels.

2147.caption: Fibroepithelial stromal polyp. Stellate multinucleated stromal cells near stromal-epithelial interface.
2147.original_caption: Fibroepithelial stromal polyp. Characteristic stellate and multinucleated stromal cells are prominent near the stromal–epithelial interface.

2148.caption: Fibroepithelial stromal polyp. Increased stromal cellularity, atypia, characteristic multinucleated cells.
2148.original_caption: Fibroepithelial stromal polyp. Increased stromal cellularity and atypia are present. Note the presence of the characteristic multinucleated cells.

2151.caption: Superficial angiomyxoma with lobulated growth, bland spindle cells in myxoid matrix. Adjacent adnexal structures indicate dermal location.
2151.original_caption: Superficial angiomyxoma. The tumor has a lobulated growth and it is composed of bland spindle cells within a myxoid matrix and show a lobulated growth. Note the presence of adnexal structures adjacent to the tumor, signifying a dermal location.

2149.caption: Deep (aggressive) angiomyxoma. Paucicellular tumor with bland spindle cells in myxoid matrix. Collagen condensation around vessels, smooth muscle bundles (upper right).
2149.original_caption: Deep (aggressive) angiomyxoma. The tumor is paucicellular and it is composed of bland spindle-shaped cells set within a striking myxoid matrix. Note the condensation of collagen around the vessels and the presence of bundles of smooth muscle (upper right).

2152.caption: Leiomyoma. Benign smooth cells with lacy growth pattern due to abundant myxohyaline matrix.
2152.original_caption: Leiomyoma. Benign-appearing smooth cells show a lacy growth pattern secondary to the abundant myxohyaline matrix associated with the tumor.

2153.caption: Condyloma acuminatum with papillary architecture. Hyperplastic squamous epithelium shows hyper-/parakeratosis.
2153.original_caption: Condyloma acuminatum. A prominent papillary architecture is seen. The papillae are lined by hyperplastic squamous epithelium showing hyper- and parakeratosis (A).

2154.caption: Condyloma acuminatum with papillary architecture. Hyperplastic squamous epithelium shows hyper-/parakeratosis.
2154.original_caption: Condyloma acuminatum. A prominent papillary architecture is seen. The papillae are lined by hyperplastic squamous epithelium showing hyper- and parakeratosis (A).

2155.caption: Condyloma acuminatum with regressed changes, polypoid architecture, focal hyperparakeratosis, lacks koilocytic changes.
2155.original_caption: Condyloma acuminatum with regressed changes. A typical polypoid architecture is associated with focal hyperparakeratosis (A) but lacks koilocytic changes (B).

2156.caption: Condyloma acuminatum with regressed changes. Polypoid architecture, focal hyperparakeratosis, no koilocytic changes.
2156.original_caption: Condyloma acuminatum with regressed changes. A typical polypoid architecture is associated with focal hyperparakeratosis (A) but lacks koilocytic changes (B).

2158.caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia, warty type. Papillary architecture with hyper-/parakeratosis, focal koilocytosis mimicking condyloma. Nuclear atypia and brisk mitoses throughout epithelium.
2158.original_caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia, warty type. A prominent papillary architecture is associated with hyper- and parakeratosis and focal koilocytic change mimicking a condyloma acuminatum (A). However, ppreciable nuclear atypia with brisk mitotic activity is seen throughout the epithelium at high-power magnification (B).

2157.caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia, warty type. Papillary architecture with hyper-/parakeratosis, focal koilocytosis mimicking condyloma. Nuclear atypia and brisk mitoses throughout epithelium.
2157.original_caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia, warty type. A prominent papillary architecture is associated with hyper- and parakeratosis and focal koilocytic change mimicking a condyloma acuminatum (A). However, ppreciable nuclear atypia with brisk mitotic activity is seen throughout the epithelium at high-power magnification (B).

2160.caption: Basaloid high-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia. Uniform "basaloid" cells, scant cytoplasm, nuclear hyperchromasia, brisk mitotic activity.
2160.original_caption: Basaloid high-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia. There is a uniform growth of “basaloid” cells with scant cytoplasm, nuclear hyperchromasia and brisk mitotic activity.

2159.caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN3). Full-thickness atypical cells, brisk mitotic activity, abnormal mitotic figure (arrow).
2159.original_caption: Classic-type high-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN3). Note full-thickness involvement by highly atypical cells with brisk mitotic activity, including an abnormal mitotic fi gure (arrow).

2161.caption: Low-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN1). Subtle nuclear changes, focal disorganization, koilocytosis (arrow). MIB-1 stain positive in upper epithelium, confirming VIN1.
2161.original_caption: Low-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN1). Only subtle nuclear changes with focal slight disorganization and koilocytosis (arrow) are seen (A). A MIB-1 stain is positive in the upper third of the epithelium, confi rming the diagnosis of VIN1 (B).

2162.caption: Low-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN1). Subtle nuclear changes, focal disorganization, koilocytosis (arrow). MIB-1 stain positive in upper epithelium, confirming VIN1.
2162.original_caption: Low-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN1). Only subtle nuclear changes with focal slight disorganization and koilocytosis (arrow) are seen (A). A MIB-1 stain is positive in the upper third of the epithelium, confi rming the diagnosis of VIN1 (B).

2164.caption: Differentiated/simplex VIN. Abnormal keratinocytes with eosinophilic cytoplasm, enlarged nuclei, prominent nucleoli. Distinct intercellular bridges. p53 overexpression in basal/suprabasilar layers.
2164.original_caption: Differentiated/simplex vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia. Abnormal keratinocytes with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm and enlarged nuclei with prominent nucleoli are seen (A). Notice the prominent and well-developed intercellular bridges (B). p53 overexpression is seen in the basal and suprabasilar layers (C).

2163.caption: Diff/simplex VIN. Abnormal keratinocytes w/ eosinophilic cytoplasm, enlarged nuclei, prominent nucleoli. Marked intercellular bridges. p53 overexpression in basal/suprabasilar layers.
2163.original_caption: Differentiated/simplex vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia. Abnormal keratinocytes with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm and enlarged nuclei with prominent nucleoli are seen (A). Notice the prominent and well-developed intercellular bridges (B). p53 overexpression is seen in the basal and suprabasilar layers (C).

2165.caption: Differentiated vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia. Abnormal keratinocytes with eosinophilic cytoplasm, enlarged nuclei, prominent nucleoli. Well-developed intercellular bridges. p53 overexpression in basal/suprabasilar layers.
2165.original_caption: Differentiated/simplex vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia. Abnormal keratinocytes with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm and enlarged nuclei with prominent nucleoli are seen (A). Notice the prominent and well-developed intercellular bridges (B). p53 overexpression is seen in the basal and suprabasilar layers (C).

2166.caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN3) with hair follicle involvement. Tangential section suggests possible broad invasion. Note squamous nests orientation and partial benign follicle involvement.
2166.original_caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia with hair follicle involvement. A tangential section of VIN3 raises suspicion for broad invasion. Notice the spatial orientation of the squamous nests and partial involvement of benign hair follicles.

2168.caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia with early stromal invasion (superficially invasive squamous carcinoma). Atypical squamous nest breaches basement membrane. Paradoxical keratinization indicates superficial invasion (arrow).
2168.original_caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia with early stromal invasion (superficially invasive squamous carcinoma). A small atypical squamous nest breaches the basement membrane (A). Paradoxical keratinization is an important feature in the recognition of superfi cial invasion (arrow) (B).

2167.caption: Superficially invasive squamous cell carcinoma. Well-oriented biopsy shows tumor thickness and depth of invasion.
2167.original_caption: Superficially invasive squamous cell carcinoma. This well-oriented biopsy is helpful in illustrating the land-marks to assess tumor thickness (A) and depth of invasion (B).

2169.caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia with early stromal invasion (superficially invasive squamous carcinoma). Atypical squamous nest breaches basement membrane. Paradoxical keratinization indicates superficial invasion (arrow).
2169.original_caption: High-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia with early stromal invasion (superficially invasive squamous carcinoma). A small atypical squamous nest breaches the basement membrane (A). Paradoxical keratinization is an important feature in the recognition of superfi cial invasion (arrow) (B).

2172.caption: Verrucous carcinoma: squamous hyperplasia with hyper-/parakeratosis, pushing border of neoplastic proliferation.
2172.original_caption: Verrucous carcinoma. Notice marked squamous hyperplasia associated with hyper- and parakeratosis and a striking pushing border of the neoplastic proliferation.

2178.caption: Primary extramammary Paget disease. Tumor cells CEA+ CK7+.
2178.original_caption: Primary extramammary Paget disease. The neoplastic cells are positive for CEA (A) and CK7 (B).

2171.caption: Basaloid carcinoma. Infiltrating anastomosing bands of small "basaloid" blue cells in stroma.
2171.original_caption: Basaloid carcinoma. Wide anastomosing bands of small “basaloid” blue cells are deeply infi ltrating the stroma.

2179.caption: Lentigo. Mild acanthosis, hyper-pigmented keratinocytes, no melanocyte increase.
2179.original_caption: Lentigo. Mild acanthosis with hyper-pigmentation of keratinocytes is seen with no increase in number of melanocytes.

2173.caption: Extramammary Paget disease. Neoplastic cells with abundant cytoplasm form confluent nests and single cells in epidermis.
2173.original_caption: Extramammary Paget disease. Neoplastic cells with abundant cytoplasm are arranged in confl uent nests and as single cells throughout the epidermis.

2176.caption: Extramammary Paget disease. Neoplastic cells infiltrate superficial dermis (<0.1 cm).
2176.original_caption: Extramammary Paget disease. Single neoplastic cells (arrows) are infiltrating the superfi cial dermis (< 0.1 cm).

2174.caption: Extramammary Paget disease. Paget cell clusters compress basal keratinocytes against basement membrane.
2174.original_caption: Extramammary Paget disease. The clusters of Paget cells compress the basal keratinocytes against the basement membrane.

2170.caption: Invasive keratinizing squamous cell carcinoma. Irregular tongues of well-moderately differentiated keratinizing neoplastic squamous cells infiltrate stroma haphazardly.
2170.original_caption: Invasive keratinizing squamous cell carcinoma. Irregular tongues of well to moderately differentiated and keratinizing neoplastic squamous cells infiltrate the stroma in a haphazard pattern.

2177.caption: Primary extramammary Paget disease. Neoplastic cells positive for CEA and CK7.
2177.original_caption: Primary extramammary Paget disease. The neoplastic cells are positive for CEA (A) and CK7 (B).

2175.caption: Extramammary Paget disease. Paget cells with intracytoplasmic melanin from epidermal melanocytes.
2175.original_caption: Extramammary Paget disease. Paget cells show some intracytoplasmic melanin transferred by epidermal melanocytes.

2180.caption: Genital nevus, small melanocyte proliferation in papillary dermis.
2180.original_caption: Typical nevus in the genital area. Proliferation of small melanocytes is present, mainly in the papillary dermis.

2181.caption: Atypical genital melanocytic nevus. Variably sized/shaped melanocyte nests at dermoepidermal junction with retraction artifact.
2181.original_caption: Atypical melanocytic nevus of the genital type. Variable-sized and shaped nests of melanocytes at the dermoepidermal junction are associated with retraction artifact.

2182.caption: Atypical genital melanocytic nevus. Dermal melanocyte nests show maturation. Upper dermis has delicate fibrosis.
2182.original_caption: Atypical melanocytic nevus of the genital type. Small nests of melanocytes in the dermis undergo maturation. There is delicate fibrosis in the upper dermis.

2183.caption: Dysplastic nevus. Fusion of rete ridges ("bridging"), lamellar fibrosis.
2183.original_caption: Dysplastic nevus. Prominent fusion of rete ridges (“bridging”) as well as lamellar fibrosis.

2188.caption: Bacterial vaginosis. Clue cells in vaginal Pap smear.
2188.original_caption: Bacterial vaginosis. Clue cells are present in a vaginal Pap smear.

2185.caption: Vulvar melanoma. Atypical tumor cells with pagetoid growth.
2185.original_caption: Vulvar melanoma. The highly atypical tumor cells show a prominent pagetoid growth.

2186.caption: Vulvar melanoma. Neoplastic cells show enlarged nuclei, prominent nucleoli, abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. Scattered pigmented cells present.
2186.original_caption: Vulvar melanoma. The neoplastic cells have enlarged nuclei with prominent nuclei and abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. Notice the presence of pigment in scattered cells.

2184.caption: Vulvar melanoma. Large epithelioid atypical melanocytes in irregular nests along epidermal basal layer.
2184.original_caption: Vulvar melanoma. A striking proliferation of large, epithelioid atypical melanocytes arranged in irregular nests is present along the basal layer of the epidermis.

2187.caption: Metastatic vulvar melanoma in sentinel lymph node. Subcapsular deposit highlighted by HMB-45 and anti-MART1.
2187.original_caption: Metastatic vulvar melanoma to sentinel lymph node. A small subcapsular deposit of metastatic melanoma is highlighted by HMB-45 and anti-MART1 staining cocktail.

2189.caption: Candida infection. Hyphal forms on Pap smear.
2189.original_caption: Candida infection. Hyphal forms are seen on a Pap smear.

2190.caption: Trichomonas vaginalis infection. "Lancet-shaped" nucleus, cytoplasmic granules seen on Pap smear (arrow).
2190.original_caption: Trichomonas vaginalis infection. An organism showing a “lancet-shaped” nucleus and fi ne cytoplasmic granules is seen (arrow) on a Pap smear.

2191.caption: Enterobiasis. Enterobius vermicularis eggs with necrosis and acute inflammation.
2191.original_caption: Enterobiasis. Multiple eggs of Enterobius vermicularis are associated with necrosis and acute infl ammation

2192.caption: Post-radiation prostate biopsy shows single cells, poorly formed glands mimicking high-grade cancer. Therapy causes glandular breakdown, architectural loss, cytoplasmic vacuolization, nuclear shrinkage/hyperchromasia/pyknosis, mucinous degeneration. Resembles high-grade cancer; avoid Gleason grading.
2192.original_caption: Treatment produces histological changes mimicking highgrade cancer. A prostate needle biopsy post-radiation treatment demonstrating single cells and poorly formed glands, simulating a highgrade cancer. Both radiation and hormone therapy cause glandular breakdown, loss of glandular architecture with either poorly formed/ compressed glands or single cells, cytoplasmic vacuolization, nuclear shrinkage, nuclear hyperchromasia and pyknosis, and mucinous degeneration. These morphological features simulate and may be mistaken for a high-grade cancer if the treatment is not suspected. Gleason grading should not be applied in this setting

2195.caption: Low-grade PIN glands (arrows) resemble benign glands but darker (a). Secretory cells show crowded, stratified, enlarged nuclei; no prominent nucleoli (b). p63 shows continuous basal layer (c).
2195.original_caption: Low-grade PIN. At scanning power, low-grade PIN glands (arrows) are architecturally similar to but appear darker than the adjacent benign glands (a). At higher magnification, the secretory cells have crowded and stratified nuclei that are enlarged and have variable sizes. No prominent nucleoli are appreciated at this magnification (b). p63 immunostain demonstrates continuous basal cell layer (c)

2194.caption: Low-grade PIN glands (arrows) resemble benign glands but darker (a). Secretory cells show crowded, stratified, enlarged nuclei; no prominent nucleoli (b). p63 shows continuous basal layer (c).
2194.original_caption: Low-grade PIN. At scanning power, low-grade PIN glands (arrows) are architecturally similar to but appear darker than the adjacent benign glands (a). At higher magnification, the secretory cells have crowded and stratified nuclei that are enlarged and have variable sizes. No prominent nucleoli are appreciated at this magnification (b). p63 immunostain demonstrates continuous basal cell layer (c)

2193.caption: Low-grade PIN glands (arrows) resemble benign glands but darker (a). Secretory cells show crowded, stratified, enlarged nuclei with size variation; no prominent nucleoli (b). p63 shows continuous basal layer (c).
2193.original_caption: Low-grade PIN. At scanning power, low-grade PIN glands (arrows) are architecturally similar to but appear darker than the adjacent benign glands (a). At higher magnification, the secretory cells have crowded and stratified nuclei that are enlarged and have variable sizes. No prominent nucleoli are appreciated at this magnification (b). p63 immunostain demonstrates continuous basal cell layer (c)

2196.caption: Cowpers glands: lobulated small uniform acini, mucus-containing cells, central duct (arrow). Bland cytology: small nuclei, inconspicuous nucleoli. Intracellular mucin vs prostate cancer's intraluminal. Stroma may contain skeletal muscle.
2196.original_caption: Cowpers glands. At low power (a), Cowpers glands are composed of tightly circumscribed or lobulated proliferation of small, uniform acini lined by mucus-containing cells with a central duct. This dimorphic population of ducts (arrow) surrounded by acini is a characteristic feature. Cytological features are bland, including small nuclei and inconspicuous nucleoli. Mucin is present in the intracellular compartment in contrast to intraluminal mucin in prostate cancer (b). Skeletal muscle is frequently present in stroma (c)

2197.caption: Cowpers glands: lobulated small uniform acini, mucus cells, central duct (arrow). Bland cytology: small nuclei, inconspicuous nucleoli. Intracellular mucin vs prostate cancer's intraluminal. Stroma may contain skeletal muscle.
2197.original_caption: Cowpers glands. At low power (a), Cowpers glands are composed of tightly circumscribed or lobulated proliferation of small, uniform acini lined by mucus-containing cells with a central duct. This dimorphic population of ducts (arrow) surrounded by acini is a characteristic feature. Cytological features are bland, including small nuclei and inconspicuous nucleoli. Mucin is present in the intracellular compartment in contrast to intraluminal mucin in prostate cancer (b). Skeletal muscle is frequently present in stroma (c)

2198.caption: Cowpers glands: lobulated small uniform acini, mucus cells, central duct (arrow). Bland cytology: small nuclei, inconspicuous nucleoli. Intracellular mucin (vs prostate cancer luminal mucin). Stroma may contain skeletal muscle.
2198.original_caption: Cowpers glands. At low power (a), Cowpers glands are composed of tightly circumscribed or lobulated proliferation of small, uniform acini lined by mucus-containing cells with a central duct. This dimorphic population of ducts (arrow) surrounded by acini is a characteristic feature. Cytological features are bland, including small nuclei and inconspicuous nucleoli. Mucin is present in the intracellular compartment in contrast to intraluminal mucin in prostate cancer (b). Skeletal muscle is frequently present in stroma (c)

2203.caption: Prostate cancer with minimal/no radiation effect post-treatment. Benign gland (upper left) shows radiation effect. Gleason grade assignable for cancer lacking significant radiation effect.
2203.original_caption: Prostate cancer showing minimum or no radiation effect after treatment. Note that a benign gland (upper left) demonstrates radiation effect. Gleason grade can be assigned for cancer without significant radiation effect

2202.caption: Verumontanum mucosal gland hyperplasia. Lobulated uniform small acini, adjacent urothelium (arrow). Intraluminal brown-orange concretions (arrow). High mag: luminal cells with small uniform nuclei, inconspicuous nucleoli.
2202.original_caption: Verumontanum mucosal gland hyperplasia. At low power (a), lobulated collection of relatively uniform, closely packed, round, small acini, frequently accompanied by adjacent urothelial epithelium (arrow) is a common presentation. Intraluminal brown-orange concretions (arrow) are a frequent and distinctive feature. At high magnification (b), the luminal cells have small uniform nuclei and inconspicuous nucleoli.

2201.caption: Verumontanum mucosal gland hyperplasia. Lobulated uniform small acini, adjacent urothelium (arrow). Intraluminal brown-orange concretions (arrow). High mag: luminal cells w/ small uniform nuclei, inconspicuous nucleoli.
2201.original_caption: Verumontanum mucosal gland hyperplasia. At low power (a), lobulated collection of relatively uniform, closely packed, round, small acini, frequently accompanied by adjacent urothelial epithelium (arrow) is a common presentation. Intraluminal brown-orange concretions (arrow) are a frequent and distinctive feature. At high magnification (b), the luminal cells have small uniform nuclei and inconspicuous nucleoli.

2204.caption: Benign prostate post-cryoablation shows tissue damage/repair: reduced glandular tissue, myxoid stroma, hemorrhage, hemosiderin (early); fibrosis, chronic inflammation (late). Residual glands exhibit regenerative changes, basal cell hyperplasia, squamous metaplasia.
2204.original_caption: Histological changes in benign prostate tissue after cryoablation. Cryoablation utilizes multiple cryoprobes filled with circulating liquid nitrogen to freeze and destroy prostate tissue. Following cryoablation, the benign prostate tissue shows features of tissue damage and repair, including marked reduction of glandular tissue (a) and prominent stroma with myxoid degeneration (a), hemorrhage, hemosiderin deposition (b), and at later stages, fibrosis and chronic inflammation. Residual viable glands show regenerative changes and basal cell hyperplasia and squamous cell metaplasia.

2199.caption: Seminal vesicle/ejaculatory duct epithelium. Small biopsy samples show branching glands with amphophilic cytoplasm, dilated lumina. Muscular layer suggests seminal vesicle. Epithelium shows hyperchromasia, pleomorphism ("monster nuclei"), pseudoinclusions. Golden-brown lipofuscin granules typical.
2199.original_caption: 7.3 Seminal vesicle/ejaculatory duct epithelium. In small biopsy samples, seminal vesicle and ejaculatory duct structures are usually not distinguishable unless biopsy targeting seminal vesicle is performed. At low power (a), peripherally located well-formed small branching glands with cytoplasmic amphophilia, budding from central dilated lumina is a common feature. Well-formed muscular layer surrounding glands favors seminal vesicle tissue but usually is not present in biopsy samples. At higher magnification (b), the epithelium lining the lumina and small glands show nuclear hyperchromasia and random pleomorphism (arrows), also referred to as “monster nuclei.” Nuclear pseudoinclusions are commonly seen. Prominent golden-brown lipofuscin granules (arrowhead) are typical.

2200.caption: 7.3 Seminal vesicle/ejaculatory duct epithelium. Small biopsies usually can't distinguish them unless targeted. Low power (a): branching glands with amphophilic cytoplasm, dilated lumina. Muscular layer suggests seminal vesicle but rare in biopsies. High power (b): luminal epithelium shows hyperchromasia, pleomorphism ("monster nuclei"), pseudoinclusions. Golden
2200.original_caption: 7.3 Seminal vesicle/ejaculatory duct epithelium. In small biopsy samples, seminal vesicle and ejaculatory duct structures are usually not distinguishable unless biopsy targeting seminal vesicle is performed. At low power (a), peripherally located well-formed small branching glands with cytoplasmic amphophilia, budding from central dilated lumina is a common feature. Well-formed muscular layer surrounding glands favors seminal vesicle tissue but usually is not present in biopsy samples. At higher magnification (b), the epithelium lining the lumina and small glands show nuclear hyperchromasia and random pleomorphism (arrows), also referred to as “monster nuclei.” Nuclear pseudoinclusions are commonly seen. Prominent golden-brown lipofuscin granules (arrowhead) are typical.

2205.caption: Benign prostate post-cryoablation shows tissue damage/repair: glandular reduction (a), myxoid stroma (a), hemorrhage, hemosiderin (b), later fibrosis/chronic inflammation. Residual glands exhibit regenerative changes, basal cell hyperplasia, squamous metaplasia.
2205.original_caption: Histological changes in benign prostate tissue after cryoablation. Cryoablation utilizes multiple cryoprobes filled with circulating liquid nitrogen to freeze and destroy prostate tissue. Following cryoablation, the benign prostate tissue shows features of tissue damage and repair, including marked reduction of glandular tissue (a) and prominent stroma with myxoid degeneration (a), hemorrhage, hemosiderin deposition (b), and at later stages, fibrosis and chronic inflammation. Residual viable glands show regenerative changes and basal cell hyperplasia and squamous cell metaplasia.

2224.caption: Urothelial metaplasia: basal cell hyperplasia with stratified basal cells, longitudinal nuclear grooves perpendicular to basement membrane.
2224.original_caption: Urothelial metaplasia. A form of basal cell hyperplasia, urothelial metaplasia consists of stratified basal cells with longitudinal nuclear grooves arranged perpendicular to the basement membrane

2218.caption: HGPIN gland near ERG+ cancer shows ERG+. Distant HGPIN glands rarely ERG+.
2218.original_caption: A HGPIN gland adjacent to ERG-positive cancer is also positive for ERG. Positive ERG staining in HGPIN glands distant from cancer is exceedingly rare

2222.caption: Small atypical glands suspicious for cancer, crowded growth, enlarged nuclei, prominent nucleoli (a). Some glands show HMWCK, basal cell distribution (b).
2222.original_caption: A focus of small atypical glands highly suspicious for cancer with crowded growth pattern and enlarged nuclei and prominent nucleoli (a). However, several glands have basal cell marker HMWCK, some in basal cell distribution (b).

2221.caption: Small atypical glands suspicious for cancer, crowded growth, enlarged nuclei, prominent nucleoli (a). Some glands show HMWCK, basal cell distribution (b).
2221.original_caption: A focus of small atypical glands highly suspicious for cancer with crowded growth pattern and enlarged nuclei and prominent nucleoli (a). However, several glands have basal cell marker HMWCK, some in basal cell distribution (b).

2219.caption: HGPIN glands (a) stained with p63/AMACR cocktail. Two glands show focal discontinuous basal cell lining, others lack basal staining (b). Most HGPIN weakly AMACR+ (b).
2219.original_caption: A focus of HGPIN glands (a) stained with a cocktail containing p63 and AMACR antibodies. Two glands have focal and discontinuous basal cell lining, whereas the other two glands have no basal cell staining (b). The majority of HGPIN is positive, at least weakly, for AMACR (b)

2217.caption: Granulomatous prostatitis secondary to blastomycosis (arrows). Differentiate from BCG therapy-related or infectious causes. Clinical history, caseous necrosis, granulomas suggest infection. Special stains may identify pathogens (arrows).
2217.original_caption: Granulomatous prostatitis secondary to blastomycosis (arrows). Nonspecific granulomatous prostatitis should be differenti ated from granulomatous inflammation secondary to BCG therapy in patients with bladder cancer or due to infectious granulomatous prostatitis. Clinical history, caseous necrosis, and well-formed granulomas provide clues to infectious etiology. Special stains for microorganisms may identify inciting agents (arrows)

2213.caption: Clear cell cribriform hyperplasia, benign prostate hyperplasia in transition zone. Nodular proliferation of nonconfluent cribriform glands with clear/eosinophilic cytoplasm. Cuboidal-columnar secretory cells with uniform nuclei. Glands rimmed by prominent basal cell layer.
2213.original_caption: Clear cell cribriform hyperplasia. (a) Clear cell cribriform hyperplasia represents a spectrum of benign prostate hyperplasia and therefore is typically encountered in the transition zone of the prostate. In this transurethral resection specimen, there is a nodular proliferation of nonconfluent cribriform glands with clear to eosinophilic cytoplasm (a). The cells forming the central lumina are cuboidal to low columnar secretory-type cells, with uniform round nuclei and clear cytoplasm. The glands (arrows) are rimmed with a prominent basal cell layer (b)

2212.caption: Clear cell cribriform hyperplasia, benign prostate hyperplasia in transition zone. Nodular proliferation of nonconfluent cribriform glands with clear/eosinophilic cytoplasm. Cuboidal-columnar secretory cells with uniform nuclei. Glands rimmed by prominent basal cell layer.
2212.original_caption: Clear cell cribriform hyperplasia. (a) Clear cell cribriform hyperplasia represents a spectrum of benign prostate hyperplasia and therefore is typically encountered in the transition zone of the prostate. In this transurethral resection specimen, there is a nodular proliferation of nonconfluent cribriform glands with clear to eosinophilic cytoplasm (a). The cells forming the central lumina are cuboidal to low columnar secretory-type cells, with uniform round nuclei and clear cytoplasm. The glands (arrows) are rimmed with a prominent basal cell layer (b)

2206.caption: Postradiation atypia in benign prostate mimics adenocarcinoma. Few atrophic glands in fibrotic stroma, lobulated/random (a,b). Random cytologic atypia: enlarged nuclei (arrows), hypochromatic nuclei, cytoplasmic vacuolization (c). Prominent nucleoli but degenerative atypia, unlike cancer. Basal cell markers aid diagnosis (d).
2206.original_caption: Postradiation atypia in benign prostate tissue mimicking adenocarcinoma. (a–d) In postradiation biopsies, there is an overall paucity of glands. At low power, glands are atrophic and arranged in lobulated (a) or random fashion (b) in a dense fibrotic stroma. These glands demonstrate random cytological atypia including occasional markedly enlarged nuclei (arrows), a tell-tale feature for radiation atypia (b). At higher magnification, prominent nucleoli are visible, raising concern for cancer. However, the cytological atypia is random and degenerative in nature, and is characterized by hypochromatic nuclei with frequent cytoplasmic vacuolization (arrow, c). Prostate adenocarcinoma rarely demonstrates this degree of cytological atypia. Basal cell markers are very helpful to confirm the diagnosis in difficult cases (d)

2210.caption: Radiation atypia in benign prostate vs adenocarcinoma post-radiation. (a) Residual adenocarcinoma: haphazard gland growth, tumor breakdown, poor gland formation, single cells, abundant cytoplasm, uniform atypia, small/shrunken nuclei. (b) Benign glands: lobular arrangement, atrophy, random degenerative nuclear atypia.
2210.original_caption: Comparison of morphological features of radiation atypia in benign prostate tissue and adenocarcinoma with radiation therapy effect. (a–b) In residual adenocarcinoma demonstrating treatment effect, cancer glands grow in a haphazard manner, show frequent tumor breakdown with poorly formed glands and single cells, relatively abundant cytoplasm, and uniform cytological atypia. Nuclei are small and frequently shrunken (a). In contrast, in benign glands with radiation atypia, glands are arranged in lobular configuration and appear atrophic. Nuclear atypia is random and degenerative in nature (b)

2215.caption: Nonspecific granulomatous prostatitis. Early lesion: dilated ducts/acini with neutrophils, giant cells, debris, desquamated epithelium. Rupture causes chronic granulomatous inflammation. Advanced lesion: dense lobular infiltrate (lymphocytes, plasma cells, eosinophils, neutrophils, epithelioid histiocytes, multinucleated giant cells), obscuring ductal
2215.original_caption: Nonspecific granulomatous prostatitis. (a) Early lesion is characterized by dilated ducts and acini filled with neutrophils, giant cells, debris, and desquamated epithelial cells. Rupture of these ducts and acini leads to localized chronic granulomatous inflammatory response (a). A more advanced lesion is characterized by dense lobular infiltrate of inflammatory cells comprised of lymphocytes, plasma cells, eosinophils and scattered neutrophils, epithelioid histiocytes, and multinucleated giant cells, obscuring and effacing the ductal and acinar structure (b). When granulomatous and chronic inflammation is florid and diffuse, prostate ducts may be obliterated, raising suspicion for a high-grade, Gleason pattern 5 carcinoma. This problem is further exaggerated by poor tissue fixation and processing artifact (c). Careful examination at high power reveals histiocytic and inflammatory nature of the lesion

2220.caption: HGPIN glands (a) stained with p63/AMACR cocktail. Two glands show focal discontinuous basal cell lining, others lack basal staining (b). Most HGPIN weakly AMACR+ (b).
2220.original_caption: A focus of HGPIN glands (a) stained with a cocktail containing p63 and AMACR antibodies. Two glands have focal and discontinuous basal cell lining, whereas the other two glands have no basal cell staining (b). The majority of HGPIN is positive, at least weakly, for AMACR (b)

2223.caption: Atrophic prostate glands retain lobulated architecture with cystic dilatation. Glands appear dark due to reduced cytoplasm. Several histologic atrophy variants exist. Common across wide age range, including early twenties.
2223.original_caption: Atrophic prostate glands retain lobulated architecture. Cystic dilatation is common. Glands appear dark due to reduced cytoplasm. There are several distinct histologic variants of atrophy. It is very common and affects patients of a wide age range, including men in their early twenties

2211.caption: Radiation atypia in benign prostate vs adenocarcinoma post-radiation. (a) Residual adenocarcinoma: haphazard gland growth, tumor breakdown, poor gland formation, single cells, abundant cytoplasm, uniform atypia, small/shrunken nuclei. (b) Benign glands: lobular arrangement, atrophy, random degenerative nuclear atypia.
2211.original_caption: Comparison of morphological features of radiation atypia in benign prostate tissue and adenocarcinoma with radiation therapy effect. (a–b) In residual adenocarcinoma demonstrating treatment effect, cancer glands grow in a haphazard manner, show frequent tumor breakdown with poorly formed glands and single cells, relatively abundant cytoplasm, and uniform cytological atypia. Nuclei are small and frequently shrunken (a). In contrast, in benign glands with radiation atypia, glands are arranged in lobular configuration and appear atrophic.
