2688.original_caption: acantholytic acanthoma. An acanthoma with focal acantholysis.

2690.caption: Lichenoid keratosis. Epidermal hyperplasia with bandlike lymphocytic infiltrate.
2690.original_caption: Lichenoid keratosis. Epidermal hyperplasia is associated with a bandlike infiltrate of lymphocytes.

2694.caption: Porphyria cutanea tarda. Noninflamed subepidermal blister. Dermal papillae rigid (festooning).
2694.original_caption: Porphyria cutanea tarda. Noninflamed subepidermal blister. the dermal papillae are rigid (festooning).

2689.original_caption: Warty dyskeratoma. The outward growth is verrucoid. The inward growing component shows suprabasilar acantholysis.

2675.caption: Uterine serous carcinoma IHC. H&E stain. Ki-67 shows diffuse intense staining. P53 stain indicates missense mutation.

2678.caption: Blastemal Wilms tumor. Undifferentiated small blue cells with Homer Wright rosettes, mimics Ewing tumors or neuroblastoma.
2678.original_caption: Blastemal Wilms tumor histology. Undifferentiated small blue cells forming Homer Wright rosettes mimics either the Ewing family of tumors or neuroblastoma.

2687.caption: Melanoma with regression. Altered stroma (edema, hypervascularity, inflammation), melanocyte loss. Primary nodular melanoma with adjacent regression features.
2687.original_caption: Melanoma with regression. A, Features of regression include an altered stroma (edema, hypervascularity, inflammation) and loss of melanocytes. B, primary nodular melanoma with adjacent features of regression.

2679.caption: Hidradenocarcinoma arising from benign hidradenoma (A, lower left). Metastasized to lymph nodes with HER2 membranous staining on IHC.
2679.original_caption: A hidradenocarcinoma can be seen arising in the context of a benign hidradenoma (A, lower left corner). This lesion metastasized to lymph nodes and the malignant cells showed intense membranous staining with HER2 on immunohistochemistry (B).

2681.caption: Dual-color SISHPro image, invasive ductal carcinoma, shows HER2 gene amplification (black, SISH) and protein overexpression (red, IHC). Endogenous HER2 signals in stromal cells noted.
2681.original_caption: Dual-color silver in situ hybridization Pro (SISHPro) image, invasive ductal carcinoma, simultaneously demonstrating HER2 gene amplification (metallic silver, SISH component, black) and overexpression of HER2-encoded protein (fast red/naphthol phosphate, immunohistochemistry component, red). Note the presence of endogenous HER2 signals in stromal cells.

2680.caption: Hidradenocarcinoma arising from benign hidradenoma (A, lower left). Metastasized to lymph nodes, HER2+ membranous staining on IHC.
2680.original_caption: A hidradenocarcinoma can be seen arising in the context of a benign hidradenoma (A, lower left corner). This lesion metastasized to lymph nodes and the malignant cells showed intense membranous staining with HER2 on immunohistochemistry (B).

2692.caption: Endometriosis. a, low-power: glands in loose stroma, hemorrhage, cesarean scar. b, high-power: endometrial glands, loose spindled stroma, inflammatory cells. C, decidualized cutaneous endometriosis: pale eosinophilic cytoplasm.
2692.original_caption: endometriosis. a, at low-power, endometriosis has glands invested in a loose stroma, often with associated hemorrhage, as in this example occurring in a cesarean section scar. b, at high-power the glands have features of endometrial glands, and the endometrial stroma consists of a loose array of slightly spindled cells and scattered inflammatory cells. C, Decidualized stromal cells have abundant pale eosinophilic cytoplasm in this case of decidualized cutaneous endometriosis.

2682.caption: Dual-color SISHPro image, invasive ductal carcinoma, shows HER2 gene amplification (black, SISH) and protein overexpression (red, IHC) in tumor cell subset, absent in adjacent cells. Endogenous HER2 signals in stroma.
2682.original_caption: Dual-color silver in situ hybridization Pro (SISHPro) image, invasive ductal carcinoma, simultaneously demonstrating phenotypic and genotypic heterogeneity; HER2 gene amplification (metallic silver, SISH component, black) and overexpression of HER2-encoded protein (fast red/naphthol phosphate, immunohistochemistry component, red) are identifi ed in a subset of tumor cells, but other contiguous tumor cells do not demonstrate HER2 gene amplification or overexpression. Note the presence of endogenous HER2 signals in stromal cells.

2686.original_caption: Melanoma with regression. A, Features of regression include an altered stroma (edema, hypervascularity, inflammation) and loss of melanocytes. B, primary nodular melanoma with adjacent features of regression.

2684.caption: Erythema induratum. A: Small artery occluded by macrophages/edema. B: SMA immunostain shows vessel wall destruction by granulomatous inflammation, minimal necrosis. C: Larger artery with patent lumen despite adjacent granulomatous inflammation (SMA+). Vessel resists damage.
2684.original_caption: Erythema induratum. A, A small artery is surrounded by macrophages and edema, and the lumen is occluded. B, An immunoreaction to show smooth muscle actin (SMA) reveals the destruction of a blood vessel wall by granulomatous inflammation, without much necrosis around it. C, The wall of an artery is surrounded by granulomatous inflammation but still has a patent lumen (immunostain for SMA). This larger vessel seems more resistant to damage by the adjacent inflammation.

2685.caption: Erythema induratum. A: Small artery occluded by macrophages/edema. B: SMA immunostain shows vessel wall destruction by granulomatous inflammation, minimal necrosis. C: Larger artery with patent lumen despite adjacent granulomatous inflammation (SMA+). More resistant to damage.

This larger vessel seems more resistant to damage by the adjacent inflammation.

2695.original_caption: desmoplastic melanoma. Silhouette of a Dm shows a diffuse fibrosing process in the dermis and subcutis. there is associated in situ melanoma.

2696.original_caption: combined (mixed) desmoplastic melanoma. a solid melanoma nodule without intratumoral fibrosis is admixed with features of typical desmoplastic melanoma.

2708.original_caption: perineural invasion by squamous cell carcinoma.

2701.caption: Ruptured epidermoid cyst with foreign body giant cell reaction to keratin.
2701.original_caption: epidermoid cyst. A ruptured epidermoid cyst results in a foreign body giant cell reaction to extravasated keratin.

2710.caption: Calciphylaxis: calcium deposit in arterial wall (arrows).
2710.original_caption: Calciphylaxis with calcium deposit in arterial wall (see arrows).

2707.original_caption: Bullous lichen planus. Florid lichenoid dermatitis with separation of the epidermis from the dermis.

2698.original_caption: Porokeratosis. Most porokeratoses show central epidermal atrophy, but this porokeratosis has a hyperplastic center. Associated lichenoid inflammatory reactions as seen here are not uncommon.

2716.original_caption: Dilated pore. a central pore is present surrounded by infundibular epithelium of normal thickness.

2705.original_caption: dysplastic nevus. Bridging and fusion of junctional nests of atypical melanocytes are apparent. there is associated dermal fibrosis and inflammation.

2755.original_caption: Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency panniculitis. A, Fat necrosis around the periphery of the lobules. B, Neutrophils dissect through the collagen of the septa and the deep dermis. this process may lead to perforation to the skin surface.

2767.caption: Intraepidermal blister. Acute spongiotic dermatitis w/ fluid-filled epidermal spaces.
2767.original_caption: Intraepidermal blister. Acute spongiotic dermatitis with multiple fluidfilled spaces within the epidermis.

2768.caption: Acantholytic blister. Keratinocyte adhesion loss, polygonal to round/oval shape change. Intercellular bridges lost.
2768.original_caption: Acantholytic blister. Loss of cell adhesion between keratinocytes has led to a change in their cell shape from polygonal to round or oval. Intercellular bridges are lost.

2769.caption: Melanoma arising with nevus. Clear cytologic distinction between melanoma and nevus cells.
2769.original_caption: Melanoma arising in association with a nevus. There is a clear distinction between the cytology of the melanoma and nevus cells.

2761.caption: Pemphigus foliaceus. Neutrophils in granular layer.
2761.original_caption: Pemphigus foliaceus. Neutrophils in the granular cell layer.

2766.caption: Spongiotic blister. Edema separates keratinocytes, connected via intercellular bridges.
2766.original_caption: Spongiotic blister. Edema separates keratinocytes, many of which are still connected to each other via intercellular bridges.

2760.caption: Pseudocyst of auricle: cystic cavity without epithelial lining in auricular cartilage, no inflammation.
2760.original_caption: pseudocyst of the auricle. A pseudocyst forms as a cystic cavity without an epithelial lining within the auricular cartilage. Note the lack of inflammation around the cartilage.

2765.caption: Intraepidermal blister. Acantholytic subcorneal blister, split below granular layer.
2765.original_caption: Intraepidermal blister. Acantholytic subcorneal blister with split underneath the granular cell layer.

2756.caption: Porocarcinoma. Carcinoma arising from poroma, atypical carcinoma cells with squamous differentiation adjacent to poroma epithelial cells.
2756.original_caption: porocarcinoma. Carcinoma arising from a preexisting poroma, transition area with atypical carcinoma cells with squamous differentiation adjacent to the bland epithelial cells of the poroma.

2763.caption: Pseudovascular changes in melanocytic nevus. artifactual clefts lined by melanocytes.
2763.original_caption: Pseudovascular changes of a melanocytic nevus. artifactual clefts are lined by melanocytes.

2758.caption: Porocarcinoma. A, invasive adenocarcinoma connected to epidermis. B, invasive component with cribriform growth. C, intraepidermal component present.
2758.original_caption: porocarcinoma. A, an invasive adenocarcinoma is seen with connection to the epidermis. B, Invasive component with cribriform growth pattern. C, an intraepidermal component is also present.

2759.caption: Porocarcinoma. A, invasive adenocarcinoma connected to epidermis. B, invasive component with cribriform growth. C, intraepidermal component present.
2759.original_caption: porocarcinoma. A, an invasive adenocarcinoma is seen with connection to the epidermis. B, Invasive component with cribriform growth pattern. C, an intraepidermal component is also present.

2757.caption: Porocarcinoma. A, invasive adenocarcinoma connected to epidermis. B, invasive component shows cribriform growth. C, intraepidermal component present.
2757.original_caption: porocarcinoma. A, an invasive adenocarcinoma is seen with connection to the epidermis. B, Invasive component with cribriform growth pattern. C, an intraepidermal component is also present.

2764.caption: Proliferating trichilemmal cyst/tumor. Circumscribed lobules of squamous cells with pushing, noninfiltrative border. Trichilemmal cyst evidence found focally.
2764.original_caption: proliferating trichilemmal cyst/tumor. A, The periphery of a proliferating trichilemmal cyst is defined by circumscribed lobules of squamous cells with a pushing, noninfiltrative border. B, Evidence of a trichilemmal cyst can usually be found at least focally.

2784.caption: Nonvasculitic inflammatory purpura; RBC extravasation, no vasculitis.
2784.original_caption: Nonvasculitic inflammatory purpura; extravasation of red blood cells without evidence of vasculitis.

2782.caption: Dermal/epidermal Langerhans cells CD1a immunopositive.
2782.original_caption: The mononuclear langerhans cells in the dermis and epidermis are immunopositive for CD1a.

2774.caption: Symmetric silhouette: A, polypoid melanocytic nevus; B, plaquelike melanocytic nevus.
2774.original_caption: Silhouette of an ordinary melanocytic nevus. A, Symmetric silhouette of an ordinary polypoid melanocytic nevus. B, Symmetric silhouette of an ordinary plaquelike melanocytic nevus.

2781.caption: Invasive squamous cell carcinoma. Irregular scalloped squamous tongues with epithelial atypia, abrupt maturation, invading dermal stroma.
2781.original_caption: invasive squamous cell carcinoma. There is an irregular scalloped contour of squamous tongues with epithelial atypia and abrupt maturation, projecting into dermal stroma

2775.caption: Symmetric silhouette: A, polypoid melanocytic nevus; B, plaquelike melanocytic nevus.
2775.original_caption: Silhouette of an ordinary melanocytic nevus. A, Symmetric silhouette of an ordinary polypoid melanocytic nevus. B, Symmetric silhouette of an ordinary plaquelike melanocytic nevus.

2783.caption: Noninflammatory small vessel thrombi seen in Coumadin necrosis, DIC, purpura fulminans.
2783.original_caption: Widespread noninflammatory small vessel thrombi characterize coagulation disorders such as Coumadin necrosis, disseminated intravascular coagulation, and purpura fulminans.

2778.caption: Apocrine cystadenoma: multilocular apocrine lesion with solid proliferative epithelium areas, papillary epithelial infoldings.
2778.original_caption: apocrine cystadenoma. An apocrine cystadenoma is a multilocular apocrine lesion with some solid areas of proliferative epithelium. In this example papillary infoldings of epithelium are present in some areas.

2787.caption: Blister with staph sepsis. Cocci clusters (septic emboli) in vessels. Ulcerated skin, necrotic epidermis sloughed.
2787.original_caption: Blister associated with staphylococcal sepsis. Clusters of cocci (septic emboli) are present within blood vessels. the skin surface is ulcerated (necrotic epidermis is sloughed off).

2779.caption: 9-19 Dermoid cyst. Lining similar to epidermoid cyst but with mature pilosebaceous units in cyst walls.
2779.original_caption: 9-19 Dermoid cyst. Dermoid cysts have a lining like an epidermoid cyst but have mature, small pilosebaceous units in their cyst walls.

2786.caption: Blister with staph sepsis. Cocci clusters (septic emboli) in vessels. Ulcerated skin, necrotic epidermis sloughed.
2786.original_caption: Blister associated with staphylococcal sepsis. Clusters of cocci (septic emboli) are present within blood vessels. the skin surface is ulcerated (necrotic epidermis is sloughed off).

2777.caption: Apocrine hidrocystoma: eyelid unilocular dermal cyst. Inner layer: eosinophilic columnar cells with apical snouts (decapitation secretion).
2777.original_caption: apocrine hidrocystoma. a, apocrine hidrocystoma of the eyelid forms a unilocular cyst in the dermis. b, the diagnostic feature of this cyst is an inner layer of eosinophilic, columnar cells with apical snouts (decapitation secretion).

2785.caption: Blister with staph sepsis. Cocci clusters (septic emboli) in vessels. Ulcerated skin (necrotic epidermis sloughed).
2785.original_caption: Blister associated with staphylococcal sepsis. Clusters of cocci (septic emboli) are present within blood vessels. the skin surface is ulcerated (necrotic epidermis is sloughed off).

2776.caption: Apocrine hidrocystoma: eyelid unilocular dermal cyst. Inner layer: eosinophilic columnar cells with apical snouts (decapitation secretion).
2776.original_caption: apocrine hidrocystoma. a, apocrine hidrocystoma of the eyelid forms a unilocular cyst in the dermis. b, the diagnostic feature of this cyst is an inner layer of eosinophilic, columnar cells with apical snouts (decapitation secretion).

2770.caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, dermal/subcutaneous nodule. B, superficial dermal nodule with collarette. C, metastasis mimicking blue nevus. D, atypical epithelioid melanocytes in nevus-like metastasis.
2770.original_caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, melanoma nodule in dermis/subcutis. B, Small superficial dermal melanoma nodule with collarette. c, metastatic melanoma simulating blue nevus. d, the blue nevus ike melanoma metastasis contains atypical epithelioid melanocytes.

2780.caption: Hypertrophic lupus erythematosus: superficial squamous proliferation with lichenoid epidermal inflammation, variable thickness, keratin plugs.
2780.original_caption: hypertrophic lupus erythematosus. There is a superficial squamous proliferation associated with an inflamed (lichenoid pattern) epidermis that shows variable thickness and keratin plugs.

2789.caption: Melanoma with blue nevus. A, melanocyte nodules with necrosis, melanosis. B, nodules in blue nevus background; transition from ordinary to cellular blue nevus, melanoma with necrosis.
2789.original_caption: Melanoma arising in association with a blue nevus. A, large nodules of melanocytes are present with focal necrosis and melanosis. B, the nodules are present in a background of blue nevus. a transition from ordinary to cellular blue nevus and melanoma with necrosis is seen.

2772.caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, dermal/subcutaneous nodule. B, superficial dermal nodule with collarette. C, melanoma mimicking blue nevus. D, blue nevus-like metastasis with atypical epithelioid melanocytes.
2772.original_caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, melanoma nodule in dermis/subcutis. B, Small superficial dermal melanoma nodule with collarette. c, metastatic melanoma simulating blue nevus. d, the blue nevus ike melanoma metastasis contains atypical epithelioid melanocytes.

2773.caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, dermal/subcutis nodule. B, superficial dermal nodule with collarette. C, melanoma mimicking blue nevus. D, blue nevus-like metastasis with atypical epithelioid melanocytes.
2773.original_caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, melanoma nodule in dermis/subcutis. B, Small superficial dermal melanoma nodule with collarette. c, metastatic melanoma simulating blue nevus. d, the blue nevus ike melanoma metastasis contains atypical epithelioid melanocytes.

2788.caption: Bullous mastocytosis. Subepidermal vesicle with mast cells in superficial dermis, metachromatic on Giemsa stain.
2788.original_caption: Bullous mastocytosis. Subepidermal vesicle (A) with numerous mast cells in superficial dermis (B), which are metachromatic by Giemsa stain (C).

2771.caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, dermal/subcutaneous nodule. B, superficial dermal nodule with collarette. C, melanoma mimicking blue nevus. D, blue nevus-like metastasis with atypical epithelioid melanocytes.
2771.original_caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, melanoma nodule in dermis/subcutis. B, Small superficial dermal melanoma nodule with collarette. c, metastatic melanoma simulating blue nevus. d, the blue nevus ike melanoma metastasis contains atypical epithelioid melanocytes.

2799.caption: Clear cell BCC with glycogenated cytoplasm.
2799.original_caption: Clear cell BCC. most of this BCC shows a clear glycogenated cytoplasm.

2803.caption: Acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis. Neutrophil aggregates in stratum corneum.
2803.original_caption: Acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis. Aggregates of neutrophils are present in the stratum corneum.

2796.caption: Fibromatosis. Bland fibroblasts in long, sweeping fascicles.
2796.original_caption: Fibromatosis. Long, sweeping fascicles of bland fibroblasts are present.

2800.caption: Nodular BCC with matrical differentiation, focus of shadow cells (arrow).
2800.original_caption: BCC with matrical differentiation. a nodular BCC shows a focus of shadow cells (arrow).

2801.caption: BCC with pleomorphic features: tumor cells show increased nuclear pleomorphism.
2801.original_caption: BCC with pleomorphic features. this BCC contains tumor cells showing a greater degree of nuclear pleomorphism than usual.

2804.caption: Chronic cutaneous lupus erythematosus. Interface dermatitis with periadnexal lymphocytic infiltrate and follicular plugging.
2804.original_caption: chronic cutaneous lupus erythematosus. Interface dermatitis with periadnexal lymphocytic infiltrate associated with follicular plugging.

2791.caption: Pancreatic enzyme fat necrosis. Granular bluish material (saponification, calcium deposition). Neutrophils often present.
2791.original_caption: pancreatic enzyme fat necrosis. granular bluish material is characteristic (because of saponification of fat and subsequent localized deposition of calcium). Neutrophils are also often present.

2793.caption: Bullous pemphigoid. Subepidermal blister. Blister cavity contains eosinophils.
2793.original_caption: Bullous pemphigoid. a, Subepidermal blister. B, the blister cavity contains eosinophils.

2798.caption: Spindle cell melanoma, nondesmoplastic. Atypical fusiform melanocytes, no significant intratumoral fibrosis.
2798.original_caption: Spindle cell melanoma.Nondesmoplastic spindle cell melanoma. the tumor is composed of atypical fusiform melanocytes without any significant intratumoral fibrosis.

2792.caption: Bullous pemphigoid. Subepidermal blister. Blister cavity with eosinophils.
2792.original_caption: Bullous pemphigoid. a, Subepidermal blister. B, the blister cavity contains eosinophils.

2790.caption: Melanoma with blue nevus. A, melanocyte nodules with necrosis, melanosis. B, nodules in blue nevus background; transition from ordinary to cellular blue nevus to melanoma with necrosis.
2790.original_caption: Melanoma arising in association with a blue nevus. A, large nodules of melanocytes are present with focal necrosis and melanosis. B, the nodules are present in a background of blue nevus. a transition from ordinary to cellular blue nevus and melanoma with necrosis is seen.

2795.caption: Fibrous hamartoma of infancy: 1) fibroblast fascicles; 2) undifferentiated mesenchymal cells in myxoid stroma; 3) mature adipose tissue; 4) fibroconnective tissue strips.
2795.original_caption: Fibrous hamartoma of infancy. Four components. 1) Fascicles of fibroblasts; 2) undifferentiated mesenchymal cells in myxoid stroma; 3) mature adipose tissue, and 4) strips of fibroconnective tissue.

2797.caption: Actinic keratosis: Basilar keratinocyte atypia, parakeratosis, solar elastosis. Early lesions lack adnexal atypia/parakeratosis.
2797.original_caption: actinic keratosis. Basilar atypia of keratinocytes, parakeratosis, and solar elastosis are characteristic. In early lesions, adnexal structures lack epithelial atypia and parakeratosis.

2802.original_caption: BCC engulfing an eccrine duct. BCCs may contain ductal structures. Usually, as in this case, they are engulfed by the tumor, but occasionally the tumor may show ductal differentiation.

2808.caption: Pigmented BCC with melanin in tumor cells and macrophages.
2808.original_caption: Pigmented BCC. melanin pigment is present in tumor cells as well as in macrophages.

2819.caption: Secondary milium from scarring, e.g., at prior biopsy site.
2819.original_caption: secondary milium. Milia may result from scarring processes, as in this example of a milium developing at a previous biopsy site.

2817.caption: Sclerotic fibroma: bland spindled cells in swirling wood grainlike collagenous stroma.
2817.original_caption: Sclerotic fibroma: Bland spindled cells are seen in a swirling wood grainlike collagenous stroma.

2812.caption: Linear IgA bullous dermatosis. Subepidermal blister. Neutrophils & eosinophils present.
2812.original_caption: Linear IgA bullous dermatosis. a, Subepidermal blister. B, there are many neutrophils and eosinophils.

2806.caption: BCC with squamous differentiation (metatypical BCC). Tumor cells show pinker cytoplasm and keratinization.
2806.original_caption: BCC with squamous differentiation (metatypical BCC). parts of the tumor cell population have a pinker cytoplasm and are keratinizing.

2807.original_caption: BCC with adenoidal features. Within the tumor nodule, a cribriform architecture is apparent.

2805.original_caption: infundibulocystic BCC. a small nodule of cytologically bland basaloid cells is present with small keratocysts.

2820.original_caption: Dariers disease. Corps grains: Pyknotic keratinocytes in stratum corneum with elongated dark nucleus and shrunken eosinophilic cytoplasm.

2810.original_caption: Cylindroma. A, Dermal and subcutaneous nodules of basaloid cells. B, the tumor cells are bland, engulf cylinders of hyaline material and are also surrounded by a hyaline membrane.

2809.original_caption: Cylindroma. A, Dermal and subcutaneous nodules of basaloid cells. B, the tumor cells are bland, engulf cylinders of hyaline material and are also surrounded by a hyaline membrane.

2822.original_caption: Sclerosing Spitzs nevus. A, Wedge-shaped intradermal melanocytic nevus. B, plump spindle and epithelioid cells, some with nuclear atypia, are embedded in fibrotic dermis.

2818.original_caption: angiofibroma (fibrous papule): Spindle and stellated cells are present in a collagenous stroma with ectatic, thin-walled blood vessels.

2811.original_caption: Linear IgA bullous dermatosis. a, Subepidermal blister. B, there are many neutrophils and eosinophils.

2828.original_caption: Foreign body giant cell reaction to suture.

2835.caption: Well-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma: predominant keratinization.
2835.original_caption: Well-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma: Keratinization is predominant.

2826.caption: Epidermolysis bullosa acquisita. Subepidermal blister.
2826.original_caption: Epidermolysis bullosa acquisita. Noninflamed subepidermal blister.

2836.original_caption: Pleomorphic liposarcoma. Numerous pleomorphic lipoblasts are present.

2827.original_caption: myofibroma. Myoid nodules and plump spindle cells with ecstatic vascular spaces.

2831.original_caption: a, Keratoacanthoma. a crateriform squamous proliferation is present with extensive hyperkeratosis. B, Keratoacanthoma associated with inflammation.

2837.original_caption: lichenoid keratosis. Several pink globules (Civatte bodies) are present at the dermal-epidermal junction and in the papillary dermis.

2832.original_caption: a, Keratoacanthoma. a crateriform squamous proliferation is present with extensive hyperkeratosis. B, Keratoacanthoma associated with inflammation.

2825.original_caption: Spitzs nevus. Fascicles of fusiform melanocytes are present in association with elongated rete ridges.

2851.original_caption: Erythema nodosum. The septa are wide and are fibrotic.

2855.original_caption: A, a compound melanocytic nevus is present, the dermal component of which shows in part features of blue nevus. B, Combined congenital and deep penetrating melanocytic nevus.

2859.original_caption: recurrent melanocytic nevus. B, histologically a melanocytic nevus is present in association with a dermal scar. c, the junctional melanocytic proliferation shows architectural disorder.

2856.original_caption: A, a compound melanocytic nevus is present, the dermal component of which shows in part features of blue nevus. B, Combined congenital and deep penetrating melanocytic nevus.

2864.original_caption: nevoid melanoma. A, the silhouette of the lesion is nevoid. there is no apparent intraepidermal melanoma. B, expansile aggregates of atypical epithelioid dermal melanocytes are present with mitotic figures.

2849.original_caption: Xanthoma. Nodular aggregate of foamy mononuclear cells. a few lymphocytes are also seen.

2858.original_caption: recurrent melanocytic nevus. B, histologically a melanocytic nevus is present in association with a dermal scar. c, the junctional melanocytic proliferation shows architectural disorder.

2857.original_caption: Melanocytic nevus with large epithelioid cells. Clusters of large epithelioid melanocytes are present in a background of small epithelioid nevomelanocytes.

2863.original_caption: nevoid melanoma. A, the silhouette of the lesion is nevoid. there is no apparent intraepidermal melanoma. B, expansile aggregates of atypical epithelioid dermal melanocytes are present with mitotic figures.

2847.caption: Pigmented poroma. Circumscribed lobulated basaloid cells connect to epidermis. Melanin present in keratinocytes.
2847.original_caption: Pigmented poroma. A, Circumscribed lobulated growth pattern of basaloid cells connecting to the epidermis. B, melanin pigment is present in keratinocytes.

2861.caption: Spitzoid melanoma. A: wedge-like silhouette, epidermal hyperplasia, pigmented spindle cell fascicles, rete ridge loss. B: dermal melanocyte mitotic figures. Fatal metastatic melanoma; initially misdiagnosed as Spitz nevus.
2861.original_caption: Spitzoid melanoma. A, this melanoma shows a wedge-like silhouette with epidermal hyperplasia. Fascicles of pigmented spindle cells are present. there is focal loss of rete ridges. B, mitotic figures are present in dermal melanocytes. the patient died of metastatic melanoma. the tumor had originally been misdiagnosed as Spitzs nevus.

2853.caption: Deep penetrating nevus. A, pigmented melanocytic nevus with wedge-shaped silhouette. B, pigmented spindle/epithelioid melanocytes and melanophages.
2853.original_caption: deep penetrating nevus. A, a pigmented melanocytic nevus with a wedge-shaped silhouette is seen. B, pigmented spindle and epithelioid melanocytes are present as well as melanophages.

2862.caption: Spitzoid melanoma. A: wedge-like silhouette, epidermal hyperplasia, pigmented spindle cell fascicles, focal rete ridge loss. B: dermal melanocyte mitotic figures. Patient died of metastatic melanoma; initially misdiagnosed as Spitz nevus.
2862.original_caption: Spitzoid melanoma. A, this melanoma shows a wedge-like silhouette with epidermal hyperplasia. Fascicles of pigmented spindle cells are present. there is focal loss of rete ridges. B, mitotic figures are present in dermal melanocytes. the patient died of metastatic melanoma. the tumor had originally been misdiagnosed as Spitzs nevus.

2845.caption: Poroma. A, Broad basaloid cell strands connect to epidermis, surround hypervascular papillae. B, Poroma with irritation; cells adjacent to keratinocytes, eosinophilic cytoplasm. C, Dermal poroma with hyalinized, hypervascular papillae.
2845.original_caption: Poroma. A, Broad anastomosing strands of small basaloid epithelial cells connected to the epidermis surround hypervascular papillae. B, poroma with surface irritation. poroma cells are juxtaposed to adjacent epidermal keratinocytes with more abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. C, Dermal poroma component with hyalinized and hypervascular papillae.

2848.caption: Syringocystadenoma papilliferum. Papillary fronds project into cystic lumen, lined by apocrine epithelial cells. Plasma cells in stroma are typical.
2848.original_caption: syringocystadenoma papilliferum. A, papillary fronds project into a cystic lumen. they are lined by apocrine type epithelial cells. B, plasma cells in the stroma of the papillae are typical.

2852.caption: Nevus spilus. Lentiginous melanocytic proliferation with basal layer hyperpigmentation.
2852.original_caption: nevus spilus. B, there is a focus of a lentiginous melanocytic proliferation in a background of basal layer hyperpigmentation.

2850.caption: Sweat gland tumor, neuroendocrine differentiation. Basaloid tumor, nodular infiltrative growth.
2850.original_caption: sweat gland tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation. Basaloid tumor with nodular and infiltrative growth pattern.

2854.caption: Deep penetrating nevus. A, pigmented melanocytic nevus with wedge-shaped silhouette. B, pigmented spindle/epithelioid melanocytes and melanophages.
2854.original_caption: deep penetrating nevus. A, a pigmented melanocytic nevus with a wedge-shaped silhouette is seen. B, pigmented spindle and epithelioid melanocytes are present as well as melanophages.

2874.caption: Sebaceous carcinoma. Possible squamous metaplasia.
2874.original_caption: sebaceous carcinoma. Squamous metaplasia may be present.

2866.caption: Burn blister. Subepidermal vesicle, no inflammation.
2866.original_caption: Burn blister. Subepidermal vesicle with no inflammation.

2869.caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. Spindle/epithelioid cells, pink cytoplasm. Eosinophils present.
2869.original_caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. Spindle and epithelioid cells with pink cytoplasm. many eosinophils are present.

2865.caption: Friction blister. Intraepidermal blister with necrotic keratinocytes.
2865.original_caption: Friction blister. Predominantly intraepidermal blister with scattered necrotic keratinocytes.

2868.caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. A, Dermal infiltrate of mononuclear cells with eosinophilic/foamy cytoplasm. B, Touton giant cells present.
2868.original_caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. A, Dermal infiltrate of mononuclear cells with eosinophilic or foamy cytoplasm. B, Touton-type giant cells are present.

2867.caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. A, Dermal infiltrate of mononuclear cells with eosinophilic/foamy cytoplasm. B, Touton giant cells present.
2867.original_caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. A, Dermal infiltrate of mononuclear cells with eosinophilic or foamy cytoplasm. B, Touton-type giant cells are present.

2875.caption: Lipodermatosclerosis: Atrophy of fat, fibrous tissue replacement. Feathery fat projections, fat cysts. Diabetic vasculopathy: glycoprotein deposition in vessel walls, subcutis interstitium.
2875.original_caption: lipodermatosclerosis: B, Ischemic changes include atrophy of the fat and fibrous tissue replacement of the fat lobules. Feathery projections of altered fat at the periphery of fat cells and fat cysts are characteristic. C, patients with diabetic vasculopathy and ischemic changes may have extensive occlusive deposition of glycoproteins in the vessel walls and in the interstitium of the subcutis.

2876.caption: Lipodermatosclerosis: Ischemic changes show fat atrophy, fibrous tissue replacement. Feathery fat projections, fat cysts. Diabetic vasculopathy: glycoprotein deposition in vessel walls, subcutis interstitium.
2876.original_caption: lipodermatosclerosis: B, Ischemic changes include atrophy of the fat and fibrous tissue replacement of the fat lobules. Feathery projections of altered fat at the periphery of fat cells and fat cysts are characteristic. C, patients with diabetic vasculopathy and ischemic changes may have extensive occlusive deposition of glycoproteins in the vessel walls and in the interstitium of the subcutis.

2870.caption: Sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-diff: sebocystic features predominate. B, Mod-diff: sebocystic features present. C, Poor-diff: rare sebocystic features. D, Poor-diff: possible spindle cell sarcomatoid.
2870.original_caption: sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-differentiated. Sebocystic features predominate. B, moderately differentiated. Sebocystic features are easily recognized, but no longer predominate. C, poorly differentiated. Sebocystic features are rare. D, poorly differentiated. Spindle cell sarcomatoid features may be present.

2871.caption: Sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-diff: sebocystic features predominate. B, Mod-diff: sebocystic features present. C, Poor-diff: rare sebocystic. D, Poor-diff: possible spindle cell sarcomatoid.
2871.original_caption: sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-differentiated. Sebocystic features predominate. B, moderately differentiated. Sebocystic features are easily recognized, but no longer predominate. C, poorly differentiated. Sebocystic features are rare. D, poorly differentiated. Spindle cell sarcomatoid features may be present.

2873.caption: Sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-diff: sebocystic features predominate. B, Mod-diff: sebocystic features present. C, Poor-diff: rare sebocystic. D, Poor-diff: possible spindle cell sarcomatoid.
2873.original_caption: sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-differentiated. Sebocystic features predominate. B, moderately differentiated. Sebocystic features are easily recognized, but no longer predominate. C, poorly differentiated. Sebocystic features are rare. D, poorly differentiated. Spindle cell sarcomatoid features may be present.

2872.caption: Sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-diff: sebocystic features predom. B, Mod-diff: sebocystic features present. C, Poor-diff: rare sebocystic. D, Poor-diff: spindle cell sarcomatoid possible.
2872.original_caption: sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-differentiated. Sebocystic features predominate. B, moderately differentiated. Sebocystic features are easily recognized, but no longer predominate. C, poorly differentiated. Sebocystic features are rare. D, poorly differentiated. Spindle cell sarcomatoid features may be present.

2883.caption: Epidermotropic metastatic melanoma in epidermis/dermis. Dermal component > intraepidermal. Lymphatic tumor emboli present.
2883.original_caption: epidermotropic metastatic melanoma to skin. A, melanoma is present in the epidermis and dermis. the greatest horizontal dimension of the dermal component exceeds that of the intraepidermal melanoma. B, lymphatic tumor emboli are present.

2884.caption: Epidermotropic metastatic melanoma in skin. Melanoma in epidermis and dermis; dermal component > intraepidermal. Lymphatic tumor emboli present.
2884.original_caption: epidermotropic metastatic melanoma to skin. A, melanoma is present in the epidermis and dermis. the greatest horizontal dimension of the dermal component exceeds that of the intraepidermal melanoma. B, lymphatic tumor emboli are present.

2878.caption: Metaplastic synovial cyst. A, Fibrous tissue villous projections into cystic cavity. B, Some projections show inflammatory/fibroblastic cells resembling hyperplastic synovium.
2878.original_caption: metaplastic synovial cyst. A, Villous projections of fibrous tissue into a cystic cavity are characteristic of metaplastic synovial cysts. B, The surfaces of some villous projections are composed of inflammatory or fibroblastic cells that resemble hyperplastic synovium.

2880.caption: Blue nevus with benign trichoblastic proliferation. A, Fusiform melanocytes in dermis, extend to subcutis. Small basaloid foci with dense stroma. B, Basaloid proliferation shows trichoblastic differentiation.
2880.original_caption: Blue nevus with benign trichoblastic proliferation. A, Fusiform melanocytes fill the dermis and extend into the superficial subcutis. Small foci of basaloid proliferations are identified with dense surrounding stroma. B, the basaloid proliferation shows trichoblastic differentiation.

2881.caption: Cellular blue nevus. A: dense dermal cellular blue nevus with deep tonguelike bulbous extension. B: dense bland epithelioid melanocyte aggregates in typical blue nevus background; rare mitosis.
2881.original_caption: cellular blue nevus. A, a densely cellular blue nevus is seen in the dermis with a deep tonguelike bulbous extension. B, Dense aggregates of cytologically bland epithelioid melanocytes are present in a background of typical blue nevus. a rare mitotic figure may be seen.

2879.caption: Blue nevus with benign trichoblastic proliferation. A, Fusiform melanocytes fill dermis, extend into superficial subcutis. Small basaloid foci with dense stroma. B, Basaloid proliferation shows trichoblastic differentiation.
2879.original_caption: Blue nevus with benign trichoblastic proliferation. A, Fusiform melanocytes fill the dermis and extend into the superficial subcutis. Small foci of basaloid proliferations are identified with dense surrounding stroma. B, the basaloid proliferation shows trichoblastic differentiation.

2882.caption: Cellular blue nevus. A, dense dermal cellular blue nevus with deep tonguelike bulbous extension. B, dense bland epithelioid melanocyte aggregates in typical blue nevus background. Rare mitotic figure possible.
2882.original_caption: cellular blue nevus. A, a densely cellular blue nevus is seen in the dermis with a deep tonguelike bulbous extension. B, Dense aggregates of cytologically bland epithelioid melanocytes are present in a background of typical blue nevus. a rare mitotic figure may be seen.

2877.caption: Metaplastic synovial cyst. A, Fibrous tissue villous projections into cystic cavity. B, Some projections surface with inflammatory/fibroblastic cells resembling hyperplastic synovium.
2877.original_caption: metaplastic synovial cyst. A, Villous projections of fibrous tissue into a cystic cavity are characteristic of metaplastic synovial cysts. B, The surfaces of some villous projections are composed of inflammatory or fibroblastic cells that resemble hyperplastic synovium.

2886.caption: Congenital melanocytic nevus. Nevomelanocytes extend into reticular dermis. Melanocytes involve adnexal structures.
2886.original_caption: congenital melanocytic nevus. A, Nevomelanocytes extend into the reticular dermis. B, Involvement of adnexal structures by melanocytes is seen.

2885.caption: Hobnail hemangioma (targetoid hemosiderotic hemangioma). Endothelial cells lining vascular spaces show bland hobnail (plump) appearance.
2885.original_caption: Hobnail hemangioma (targetoid hemosiderotic hemangioma). B, the endothelial cells lining the vascular spaces are bland, but show a hobnail (plump) appearance.

2887.caption: Congenital melanocytic nevus. A, Nevomelanocytes in reticular dermis. B, Melanocytes involve adnexal structures.
2887.original_caption: congenital melanocytic nevus. A, Nevomelanocytes extend into the reticular dermis. B, Involvement of adnexal structures by melanocytes is seen.

2888.caption: Proliferative nodule in giant congenital nevus. Dense dermal melanocyte aggregate with mitotic figures.
2888.original_caption: 12-31 Proliferative nodule in a giant congenital nevus. B, histologically, at the site of a nodule, a dense aggregate of melanocytes is seen in the dermis with mitotic figures.

2899.caption: Acute telogen effluvium. Predominant terminal anagen hairs.
2899.original_caption: acute telogen effluvium. There is a predominance of terminal anagen hairs.

2907.caption: Apocrine adenoma: inner epithelial cells with pink cytoplasm, apocrine secretion.
2907.original_caption: Apocrine adenoma. the inner epithelial cells show abundant pink cytoplasm and apocrine-type secretion.

2906.caption: Hidradenoma papilliferum: inner epithelial cells with pink cytoplasm, apocrine-type secretion.
2906.original_caption: hidradenoma papilliferum. the inner epithelial cells show abundant pink cytoplasm and apocrine-type secretion.

2891.caption: Melanoma arising from congenital nevus. Superficial bland nevomelanocytes, underlying dermal melanoma with atypical epithelioid tumor cells.
2891.original_caption: Melanoma arising in association with a congenital nevus. B, Superficially, bland nevomelanocytes are present. Underneath is a dermal melanoma composed of atypical epithelioid tumor cells.

2904.caption: Giant cell fibroblastoma: spindled/stellate tumor cells with multinucleated cells in myxoid/hyalinized stroma, lining pseudovascular spaces.
2904.original_caption: giant cell fibroblastoma. (A) giant cell fibroblastoma is composed of spindled to stellate tumor cells punctuated by multinucleated tumor cells in a myxoid to hyalinized background. (B) the multinucleated cells frequently line pseudovascular spaces.

2894.caption: Omphalomesenteric duct cyst. a, Polypoid configuration. b, Transition to hyperplastic keratinizing squamous epithelium. Gastrointestinal epithelium may line polyp/cyst. c, Gastric. d, Colon
2894.original_caption: omphalomesenteric duct cyst. a, Omphalomesenteric duct polyps have a polypoid configuration from scanning magnification. B, An abrupt transition from the polyp to hyperplastic keratinizing squamous epithelium of adjacent skin is typical. Various types of gastrointestinal epithelium may line the polyp or cyst. C, Gastric. D, Colon

2902.original_caption: Alopecia Areata. A, Patchy areas of baldness. B, There is an increase in the proportion of telogen hair (horizontal section). 2900.caption: Alopecia Areata. A, Patchy baldness. B, Increased telogen hair (horizontal section). C, Peribulbar lymphocytes (horizontal section). D, Lymphocytes swarm & infiltrate bulb (vertical section).

2908.caption: Tricholemmoma: superficial dermal nodule of cuboidal keratinocytes with lobular growth pattern, associated with follicle. Clear cell changes common. Dense pink membrane surrounds lobular proliferation base.
2908.original_caption: Tricholemmoma. A, a superficial dermal nodule of small cuboidal keratinocytes with a lobular growth pattern is associated with a follicle. B, Clear cell changes are common. Note also the dense pink membrane surrounding the base of the lobular proliferation.

2922.caption: Mucin. edematous matrix w/ bluish granules & fibroblasts.
2922.original_caption: Mucin. edematous matrix with bluish granules and fibroblasts.

2921.caption: Melanoma. A, tumor silhouette asymmetric. B, polypoid melanoma.
2921.original_caption: Melanoma. A, the silhouette of the tumor is asymmetric. B, polypoid melanoma.

2914.caption: Carcinoma ex cylindroma: poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma adjacent to cylindroma nodule.
2914.original_caption: Carcinoma ex cylindroma. a poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma is present (A) adjacent to nodule of cylindroma (B).

2915.caption: Poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma adjacent to cylindroma nodule. Carcinoma ex cylindroma.
2915.original_caption: Carcinoma ex cylindroma. a poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma is present (A) adjacent to nodule of cylindroma (B).

2911.caption: Full-thickness epidermal atypia with loss of maturation indicates in situ squamous cell carcinoma, present in actinic keratosis background.
2911.original_caption: Full-thickness epidermal atypia with loss of normal maturation indicates in situ (intraepidermal) squamous cell carcinoma. this feature was present in a background of an actinic keratosis.

2912.caption: Microinvasive squamous cell carcinoma. Atypical keratinocytes in papillary dermis (arrow). Associated with acantholytic AK.
2912.original_caption: microinvasive squamous cell carcinoma. solated cells and small cell clusters of atypical keratinocytes are seen in the papillary dermis (arrow). This microinvasive SCC arose in association with an acantholytic AK.

2920.caption: Melanoma. A, tumor silhouette asymmetric. B, polypoid melanoma.
2920.original_caption: Melanoma. A, the silhouette of the tumor is asymmetric. B, polypoid melanoma.

2925.caption: Pemphigus vulgaris. A, Suprabasilar acantholytic blister with inflammation. B, Polymorphonuclear cells predominant.
2925.original_caption: Pemphigus vulgaris. A, Suprabasilar acantholytic blister cavity with inflammatory cells. B, Polymorphonuclear cells predominate.

2910.caption: Acantholytic actinic keratosis. Clefts between basilar/suprabasilar keratinocytes due to acantholysis.
2910.original_caption: acantholytic actinic keratosis. Clefts are seen between basilar and suprabasilar keratinocytes reflecting towing to acantholysis.

2927.caption: Cavernous lymphangioma in reticular dermis/subcutis, composed of proliferating vessels with bland endothelial cells and lymphocytic infiltrate.
2927.original_caption: Cavernous lymphangioma. The lesion is typically present in the reticular dermis and/or subcutis. It is composed of a complex proliferation of vessels lined by bland endothelial cells. An associated lymphocytic infiltrate is commonly present.

2918.caption: Melanoma in situ, pagetoid pattern. De novo pagetoid melanoma in situ. Pagetoid melanoma in situ with melanocytic nevus.
2918.original_caption: Melanoma in situ, pagetoid pattern. A, De novo pagetoid melanoma in situ. B, pagetoid melanoma in situ arising in association with a melanocytic nevus.

2917.caption: Mucocele: fluid-filled cyst under oral mucosa, minor salivary gland beneath. Histiocytes with vacuolated cytoplasm (muciphages) from ingested mucin, no epithelial lining.
2917.original_caption: mucocele. a, a fluid-filled cyst underlying oral mucosa is typical of a mucocele. Note the minor salivary gland beneath the cyst, indicating that this cyst arose from the superficial portion of a salivary duct. b, histiocytes with vacuolated cytoplasm (muciphages) result from ingested mucin. Note the absence of an epithelial lining.

2916.caption: Mucocele: fluid-filled cyst under oral mucosa, minor salivary gland beneath. Histiocytes with vacuolated cytoplasm (muciphages) from ingested mucin, no epithelial lining.
2916.original_caption: mucocele. a, a fluid-filled cyst underlying oral mucosa is typical of a mucocele. Note the minor salivary gland beneath the cyst, indicating that this cyst arose from the superficial portion of a salivary duct. b, histiocytes with vacuolated cytoplasm (muciphages) result from ingested mucin. Note the absence of an epithelial lining.

2909.caption: Tricholemmoma: superficial dermal nodule of cuboidal keratinocytes, lobular growth pattern, follicle association. Clear cell changes present. Dense pink membrane at lobular base.
2909.original_caption: Tricholemmoma. A, a superficial dermal nodule of small cuboidal keratinocytes with a lobular growth pattern is associated with a follicle. B, Clear cell changes are common. Note also the dense pink membrane surrounding the base of the lobular proliferation.

2923.caption: Basomelanocytic tumor. Melanoma metastasized to basal cell carcinoma site (collision). gp100 immunostain shows melanoma colonizing BCC, simulating basomelanocytic tumor pattern.
2923.original_caption: Basomelanocytic tumor. A, melanoma has metastasized to the site of basal cell carcinoma (collision phenomenon). B, an immunostain for gp100 (hmB-45) demonstrates that the basal cell carcinoma has been colonized by melanoma cells simulating the pattern of what has been referred to as basomelanocytic tumor.

2924.caption: Basomelanocytic tumor. Melanoma metastasized to basal cell carcinoma site (collision). Gp100 immunostain (hmB-45) shows melanoma colonizing basal cell carcinoma, simulating basomelanocytic tumor pattern.
2924.original_caption: Basomelanocytic tumor. A, melanoma has metastasized to the site of basal cell carcinoma (collision phenomenon). B, an immunostain for gp100 (hmB-45) demonstrates that the basal cell carcinoma has been colonized by melanoma cells simulating the pattern of what has been referred to as basomelanocytic tumor.

2913.caption: Carcinoma ex spiradenoma: poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma (arrow) adjacent to spiradenoma (arrow head).
2913.original_caption: Carcinoma ex spiradenoma. a poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma (arrow) is seen adjacent to a spiradenoma (arrow head).

2919.caption: Melanoma in situ, pagetoid pattern. A, De novo pagetoid melanoma in situ. B, Pagetoid melanoma in situ with melanocytic nevus.
2919.original_caption: Melanoma in situ, pagetoid pattern. A, De novo pagetoid melanoma in situ. B, pagetoid melanoma in situ arising in association with a melanocytic nevus.

2926.caption: Pemphigus vulgaris. A, Suprabasilar acantholytic blister with inflammation. B, Polymorphonuclear cells predominant.
2926.original_caption: Pemphigus vulgaris. A, Suprabasilar acantholytic blister cavity with inflammatory cells. B, Polymorphonuclear cells predominate.

2928.caption: Neutrophilic muscular vessel vasculitis with elastic lamina loss (elastic stain, top).
2928.original_caption: Neutrophilic muscular vessel vasculitis associated with loss of the elastic lamina (elastic tissue stain, top).

2938.caption: Epithelioid sarcoma with nodules of epithelioid tumor cells and central necrosis.
2938.original_caption: epithelioid sarcoma. There are nodules of epithelioid tumor cells. Central necrosis is often present.

2932.caption: Traumatic neuroma. Disorganized nerves in scar.
2932.original_caption: traumatic neuroma. Disorganized nerves embedded in a scar.

2942.caption: Cholesterol emboli: intravascular clefted spaces with multinucleated giant cells.
2942.original_caption: Cholesterol emboli are identified by intravascular clefted spaces surrounded by multinucleated giant cells.

2929.caption: Neutrophilic muscular vessel vasculitis with elastic lamina loss (elastic stain, top).
2929.original_caption: Neutrophilic muscular vessel vasculitis associated with loss of the elastic lamina (elastic tissue stain, top).

2931.caption: Leiomyosarcoma. Fascicular pattern, nuclear hyperchromasia, atypia, mitotic activity.
2931.original_caption: leiomyosarcoma. Intersecting fascicular pattern of benign smooth muscle tumors but with nuclear hyperchromasia, atypia, and mitotic activity.

2930.caption: Small vessel neutrophilic vasculitis (leukocytoclastic vasculitis) shows fibrin deposits, nuclear debris, neutrophils disrupting postcapillary venule.
2930.original_caption: Small vessel neutrophilic vasculitis (leukocytoclastic vasculitis) is identified by the presence of fibrin deposits, nuclear debris, and neutrophils disrupting a postcapillary venule.

2944.caption: Subcutaneous panniculitic T-cell lymphoma. A, Lymphoid cells apposed to fat cells, forming rings. B, Focal phagocytosis of lymphoid cells.
2944.original_caption: Subcutaneous panniculitic t-cell lymphoma. A, Numerous lymphoid cells a cells are closely apposed to the surface of the fat cells, forming rings around them. B, There is focal phagocytosis of the lymphoid cells.

2941.original_caption: Melanoma metastatic to lymph node. A, Silhouette of a lymph node with nonpigmented metastatic tumor deposit. B, the tumor cells are immunoreactive for melan-a.

2940.original_caption: Melanoma metastatic to lymph node. A, Silhouette of a lymph node with nonpigmented metastatic tumor deposit. B, the tumor cells are immunoreactive for melan-a.

2939.original_caption: Melanoma metastatic to lymph node. Cytologically atypical and pigmented tumor cells are present.

2935.caption: Clark levels: I (epidermis), II (epidermis/papillary dermis, unfilled), III (fills papillary dermis), IV (reticular dermis, collagen surrounds), V (subcutaneous fat).

Coarse reticular dermal collagen bundles surround melanoma cells. e, Clark level V: melanoma extends into subcutaneous adipose tissue.

3154.original_caption: Metastatic melanoma. Fine needle biopsy cytology. Low power micrograph showing large numbers of dissociating pleomorphic epithelioid cells in a lightly blood-stained background (Romarowsky stained smear).

3153.original_caption: Metastatic melanoma: fine needle biopsy cytology. High power micrograph showing large pleomorphic epithelioid cells with prominent nucleoli. Two mitotic figures are present. 3151.caption: Merkel cell carcinoma, paranuclear dot-like CK20 staining.
3151.original_caption: Merkel cell carcinoma with paranuclear dot–ike staining for CK20.

3155.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of ductal type. Low power micrograph of punch biopsy of skin showing cohesive clusters of pleomorphic epithelioid cells within the dermis.

3157.caption: Metastatic ductal breast carcinoma. Tumor in dermal lymphatic channel.
3157.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of ductal type. High power micrograph showing tumor within a dermal lymphatic channel.

3158.caption: Metastatic ductal breast carcinoma. Micrograph shows tumor nests with focal gland formation.
3158.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of ductal type. Medium power micrograph showing nests of tumor with focal gland formation.

3160.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of ductal type. Medium power micrograph showing islands of tumor associated with surrounding dense sclerotic dermal collagenous stroma.

3156.caption: Metastatic melanoma. Necrotic tumor in dermis/subcutis. Epidermis separated by grenz zone.
3156.original_caption: Metastatic melanoma. Low power micrograph showing a centrally necrotic tumor involving the dermis and subcutis. The uninvolved epidermis is separated from the underlying tumor by a so-called grenz zone of uninvolved dermis.

3159.caption: Metastatic lung adenocarcinoma. Clusters of pleomorphic epithelioid cells with focal gland formation.
3159.original_caption: Metastatic adenocarcinoma from the lung. High power micrograph showing clusters of large pleomorphic epithelioid cells with focal gland formation.

3163.caption: Metastatic lobular breast carcinoma. Tumor cells show AE1/AE3 anticytokeratin positivity.
3163.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of lobular type. Medium power micrograph showing positive staining of tumor cells with the broad spectrum anticytokeratin antibody AE1/AE3.

3162.caption: Metastatic lobular breast carcinoma. Micrograph: single files of large epithelioid cells between dermal collagen bundles.
3162.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of lobular type. Medium power micrograph showing single files of large epithelioid cells dissecting between the dermal collagen bundles.

3164.caption: Metastatic lobular breast carcinoma. Tumor cells show ER-positive staining.
3164.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of lobular type. Medium power micrograph showing positive staining of tumor cells for estrogen receptor.

3161.caption: Metastatic lobular breast carcinoma. Micrograph shows single files and small cell clusters. Morphology unclear; immunostains needed to exclude lymphoma, melanoma, or epithelioid sarcoma.
3161.original_caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of lobular type. Low power micrograph showing single files and small clusters of cells. It is not possible to be certain from the morphologic appearance that this tumor is a carcinoma. Appropriate immunostains to exclude other possibilities (e.g., a large cell lymphoma, melanoma, or epithelioid sarcoma) are necessary

3171.caption: Metastatic Merkel cell carcinoma. CK20+ tumor cells.
3171.original_caption: Metastatic Merkel cell carcinoma. High power micrograph showing positive staining of the tumor cells for CK20.

3167.original_caption: Metastatic thyroid carcinoma of follicular type. Medium power micrograph showing positive staining of tumor cells for thyroglobulin.

3172.caption: Metastatic melanoma. Dermal clusters of pleomorphic epithelioid cells. Immunostains required to confirm melanoma vs poorly differentiated carcinoma/lymphoma/sarcoma.
3172.original_caption: Metastatic melanoma. High power micrograph showing clusters of pleomorphic epithelioid cells within the dermis. In the absence of intracytoplasmic melanin pigment, an appropriate panel of immunostains would be necessary to confirm that the tumor is a melanoma and not a poorly differentiated carcinoma, lymphoma, or sarcoma

3170.caption: Metastatic Merkel cell carcinoma. Tumor sheets with high N:C ratio, granular chromatin, inconspicuous nucleoli. Frequent mitoses and apoptosis.
3170.original_caption: Metastatic Merkel cell carcinoma. High power micrograph showing tumor composed of sheets of cells with high nuclear to cytoplasmic ratio, granular chromatin, and mostly inconspicuous nucleoli. Frequent mitoses and apoptotic cells are present.

3165.original_caption: Metastatic thyroid carcinoma of follicular type. Low power micrograph showing clusters of epithelioid cells with focal follicle formation.

3173.original_caption: Epidermotropic metastatic melanoma mimicking primary melanoma. Medium power micrograph showing epidermal and dermal components to the tumor. The diagnosis cannot be made without clinicopathologic correlation.

3174.original_caption: large cell acanthoma. he keratinocytes of large cell acanthoma enlarged nuclei compared to adjacent nonlesional keratinocytes. Hyperchromatism is lacking. There is good evidence of maturation. Pigmentation is common.

3179.original_caption: Angioleiomyoma. Vascular lumens are surrounded by a proliferation of smooth muscle cells.
